name: Sweet Chilli Haloumi Noodles
subtitle: with Pak Choy and Crunchy Shallots
name_with_subtitle: Sweet Chilli Haloumi Noodles with Pak Choy and Crunchy Shallots
description: Sticky and sweet with a little bit of heat, these slippery noodles will get your tastebuds dancing. Toss with veggies, then top with golden pan-fried haloumi.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Bring a medium saucepan of water to the boil for the noodles. Coarsely chop the __pak choy__, keeping the leaves and stems separate. Thinly slice the __capsicum__ (see Cooking tip). Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__. Cut the __haloumi__ into 2cm chunks.

steps.title: Cook noodles
steps.description: Cook the __noodles__ in the pan of boiling water for 2 mins or until tender. Drain, then rinse under hot water to prevent the noodles from sticking. Meanwhile, combine the __sweet chilli sauce__ (see Make it yours) and __1 tbs water__ in a bowl.

steps.title: Pan-fry haloumi
steps.description: Heat __2 tsp vegetable oil__ in a medium frypan over medium-high heat. Cook the __haloumi__, turning occasionally, for 2 mins or until golden. Add __half the sauce mixture__ and bring to the boil. Remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Stir-fry veggies
steps.description: Heat __2 tsp vegetable oil__ in a medium deep frypan over medium heat. Stir-fry the __pak choy stems__ and __capsicum__ for 4-5 mins until tender. Add the __garlic__ and stir-fry for 30 secs or until fragrant. Add the __pak choy leaves__, __noodles__, __remaining sauce mixture__ and __1 tbs soy sauce__ and stir-fry for a further 1 min or until combined. Remove from the heat.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Divide the __veggies and noodles__ among bowls, top with the __haloumi__ and scatter over the __fried shallots__. Enjoy!

steps.title: Make it yours
steps.description: Sweet chilli sauce isn't very hot, but if serving this to little ones, you might like to adjust the amount to taste or leave it out altogether and serve it at the table instead.

chef.name: Mel Burge
chef.description: Mel loves spicy Mexican food, chicken burgers and baking for all types of occasions.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Mel brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Her passion for food and cooking began at a young age and led her to the New Idea Test Kitchen, where she developed and tested recipes over a period of 10 years. She's also worked for other major food brands including Taste, Arnott’s, Donna Hay and Perfection Fresh. Mel also specialises in cake decorating and runs a small side business in her spare time.

cooking_tip: Due to supply shortages, we've substituted yellow capsicum for the red capsicum, pictured. Don't worry, the dish will be just as delicious!

name: Pork Sausage and Sweet Potato Braise
subtitle: with Greens
name_with_subtitle: Pork Sausage and Sweet Potato Braise with Greens
description: Looking for a fuss-free dinner with minimal washing up? This one-pan recipe dishes up sausages slowly braised in a smoky tomato sauce, chunks of sweet potato and kale. Put your feet up and let the stove do most of the work.

steps.title: Prep veggies
steps.description: Thinly slice the __onion__. Peel the __sweet potato__ and cut into 1.5cm chunks. Remove the tough inner stems from the __kale__, then coarsely chop the leaves. Crush or finely chop __1 garlic clove__.

steps.title: Brown sausages
steps.description: Heat __2 tsp olive oil__ in a medium deep frypan over medium-high heat. Cook the __sausages__, turning occasionally, for 3-4 mins until browned. Remove from the pan.

steps.title: Start sauce
steps.description: Reduce the heat to medium-low and add the __onion__ and __garlic__ to the pan. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 2 mins or until softened. Stir in __2 tsp smoked paprika__ (see Did you know?) and __1 tbs tomato paste__ and cook for 1 min or until fragrant.

steps.title: Simmer sauce
steps.description: Add the __sausages__, __sweet potato__, __tomatoes__, __2 tsp sugar__ and __2 tbs water__ to the sauce. Bring to the boil, then reduce the heat to medium-low and cook, covered, for 25 mins or until the sweet potato is tender.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Add the __kale__ to the pan and cook, covered, for a further 2-3 mins until wilted. Remove the pan from the heat. Taste, then season with __salt and pepper__. Divide the __sausage braise__ among plates and enjoy!

steps.title: Did you know?
steps.description: Smoked paprika, made from dried capsicum, is popular in Spanish and Hungarian cuisines, but is believed to have originated in Mexico. The sweet, smoky spice adds a delicious depth of flavour.

chef.name: Yasmin and Dinnerly Team
chef.description: Easy and simply delicious home-cooked meals that everyone will love.
chef.bio:
Yasmin's passion for food began at a young age, watching on as her mum and dad cooked in the home kitchen and tasting global cuisines as her family travelled the world. Since then, her impressive career has spanned magazines, television and radio with a roll call of Australian brands. Yasmin is also the author of two best-selling books, 7000 Islands: Cherished Recipes and Stories from the Philippines, and The Desserts of New York (And How to Eat Them All), which combine her love of food and travel.

Yasmin and the talented Dinnerly team of recipe developers, including Jane Howard and Louise Pickford, hope we've made dinnertime that much easier, tastier, quicker and more fun for you and your family. Enjoy!

name: Super-Veggie Risotto
subtitle: with Cream Cheese
name_with_subtitle: Super-Veggie Risotto with Cream Cheese
description: Cheese: the answer to most of life's problems. Here, we've boosted the decadence of a scrumptious veggie risotto by adding cream cheese. Even the littlest diner won't be able to resist.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__. Finely chop the __onion__. Cut the __broccoli__ stem into 1cm chunks. Cut the head into small florets. Peel the __pumpkin__ and cut into 2cm chunks.

steps.title: Prep stock
steps.description: Crumble the __stock cubes__ into a heatproof jug, add __625ml (2½ cups) boiling water__ and stir to dissolve.

steps.title: Soften onion
steps.description: Heat __1 tbs olive oil__ in a medium deep frypan over medium heat. Cook the __garlic__ and __onion__, stirring occasionally, for 4 mins or until softened. Add the __broccoli stem__ and __rice__ (see Make it yours), season with __salt and pepper__ and stir to combine.

steps.title: Simmer risotto
steps.description: Add the __stock__ to the rice mixture and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat to medium, cover and cook for 10 mins. Stir in the __pumpkin__ and __broccoli florets__ and cook, covered, for a further 10 mins or until the liquid is absorbed and the rice and veggies are tender. Remove the pan from the heat and stand, covered, for 5 mins.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Gently stir __half the cream cheese*__ into the risotto. Taste, then season with __salt and pepper__. Divide the __veggie risotto__ among bowls and enjoy!

steps.title: Make it yours
steps.description: If you want to hide the veggies from the kids, add the broccoli florets and pumpkin to the pan with the rice so that they completely break down during cooking.

chef.name: Mel Burge
chef.description: Mel loves spicy Mexican food, chicken burgers and baking for all types of occasions.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Mel brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Her passion for food and cooking began at a young age and led her to the New Idea Test Kitchen, where she developed and tested recipes over a period of 10 years. She's also worked for other major food brands including Taste, Arnott’s, Donna Hay and Perfection Fresh. Mel also specialises in cake decorating and runs a small side business in her spare time.

name: Balanced Spicy Texan Chicken
subtitle: with Wholegrain Rice and Corn Salsa
name_with_subtitle: Balanced Spicy Texan Chicken with Wholegrain Rice and Corn Salsa
description: Hang up your spurs and saddle and sit down to big Texan flavours! There's spicy chicken tenders, nourishing rice to keep bellies full, and a spiced corn and cucumber salsa to top it off.

steps.title: Cook rice
steps.description: Fill a medium saucepan three-quarters full with water and bring to the boil. Add the __rice__ (see Cooking tip) and cook for 25 mins or until tender. Drain. Meanwhile, quarter the __cucumber__ lengthwise, then cut into 1cm chunks. Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__. Drain and rinse the __corn__.

steps.title: Fry corn
steps.description: Heat __1 tsp olive oil__ in a medium frypan over medium-high heat. Cook the __corn__ and __½ tsp Mexican spice blend__ (see Make it yours), stirring occasionally, for 2-3 mins until golden. Transfer the corn to a bowl. Reserve the pan.

steps.title: Cook chicken
steps.description: Put the __chicken__, __garlic__, __1 tsp Mexican spice blend__ and __2 tsp olive oil__ in a bowl, season with __salt and pepper__ and toss to coat. Heat the reserved pan over medium-high heat. Cook the chicken for 3-4 mins each side until browned and cooked through. Transfer the chicken to a board.

steps.title: Simmer sauce
steps.description: Return the pan to medium heat. Add the __tomatoes__, __1 tsp Mexican spice blend__, __2 tsp honey__ and __125ml (½ cup) water__. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 4 mins or until slightly thickened. Meanwhile, shred the __chicken__ with two forks. Add the chicken to the sauce and stir to combine. Remove the pan from the heat. Taste, then season with __salt and pepper__.

steps.title: Make salsa and serve up
steps.description: Add the __cucumber__, __1 tsp red wine vinegar__ and __1 tsp olive oil__ to the corn, season with __salt and pepper__ and stir to combine. Divide the __rice__ and __chicken__ among bowls, scatter over the __corn salsa__ and enjoy!

steps.title: Make it yours
steps.description: Our Mexican spice blend has a chilli kick. If you don't like too much heat or you have little ones, use less or simply season the corn and chicken (in Step 3) with salt and pepper instead.

assumed_ingredients.name: 1 tsp red or white wine vinegar

chef.name: Mel Burge
chef.description: Mel loves spicy Mexican food, chicken burgers and baking for all types of occasions.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Mel brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Her passion for food and cooking began at a young age and led her to the New Idea Test Kitchen, where she developed and tested recipes over a period of 10 years. She's also worked for other major food brands including Taste, Arnott’s, Donna Hay and Perfection Fresh. Mel also specialises in cake decorating and runs a small side business in her spare time.

cooking_tip: Due to supply shortages, we've substituted red rice for the brown rice, pictured. Don't worry, the dish will be just as delicious!

name: 20-Minute Creamy Coconut Pork Pasta
subtitle: with Tomato Salsa
name_with_subtitle: 20-Minute Creamy Coconut Pork Pasta with Tomato Salsa
description: Who doesn't love a creamy pasta? Especially when it's ready in record time. This dairy-free option uses coconut milk to produce a rich, luscious bowl of comfort.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Bring a medium saucepan of salted water to the boil for the pasta. Thinly slice the __spring onion__ on an angle. Finely chop the __tomatoes__. Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__. Put the __green part of the spring onion__, __2 tbs chopped tomato__, __2 tsp red wine vinegar__ and a __generous drizzle of olive oil__ in a bowl. Season with __salt and pepper__ and toss to combine.

steps.title: Cook pasta and pork
steps.description: Cook __three-quarters of the pasta*__ in the pan of boiling water for 12 mins or until al dente (see Kitchen 101). Drain. Meanwhile, heat a __drizzle of olive oil__ in a medium deep frypan over high heat. Cook the __pork mince__, breaking up the lumps with a spoon, for 3-4 mins until browned.

steps.title: Start sauce
steps.description: Add the __garlic__, __white part of the spring onion__ and __remaining tomato__ to the pork and cook, stirring, for 3 mins or until softened. Stir in the __barbecue seasoning__ and __2 tbs tomato paste__ and cook for 1 min or until fragrant.

steps.title: Simmer sauce
steps.description: Add the __coconut milk__ and __60ml (¼ cup) water__ to the pork mixture. Bring to the boil, then reduce the heat to medium and cook, stirring, for 5 mins or until thickened. Taste, then season with __salt and pepper__. Add the __pasta__ to the sauce and toss to combine. Remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Divide the __creamy pork pasta__ among bowls and generously drizzle with __barbecue sauce__, if using. Spoon over the __tomato salsa__ and enjoy!

steps.title: Kitchen 101
steps.description: Don't be tempted to cook the pasta any longer than this – it will continue to cook to perfect doneness when it is added to the pan in Step 4.

assumed_ingredients.name: 2 tsp red or white wine vinegar

chef.name: Bree Hutchins
chef.description: Bree loves nutritious plant-based recipes, global cuisines and cooking for celebrations.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Bree brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Criminal lawyer turned food photographer and recipe developer, Bree has eaten her way across six continents, invited herself into countless kitchens and gathered recipes from around the globe. She’s written, styled and photographed her own cookbooks, contributed to titles for leading Australian publishers and founded a start-up that sells plant-based remakes of classic treats.

name: Asian Chicken Noodle Salad
subtitle: with Cucumber and Mint
name_with_subtitle: Asian Chicken Noodle Salad with Cucumber and Mint
description: It may be winter, but main-course salads can still hit the mark, especially when they're brimming with lots of good stuff like chicken, cucumber, fresh mint and slurpy noodles. A sweet chilli dressing adds extra oomph!

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Bring a medium saucepan of water to the boil for the noodles. Quarter the __cucumber__ lengthwise and thinly slice on an angle. Pick the __mint__ leaves, discarding the stems. Thinly slice the __chicken__.

steps.title: Cook noodles
steps.description: Cook the __noodles__ in the pan of boiling water for 7 mins or until tender. Drain, then rinse under cold water to prevent the noodles from sticking.

steps.title: Brown chicken
steps.description: Meanwhile, heat __1 tbs vegetable oil__ in a medium frypan over high heat. Stir-fry the __chicken__ for 2-3 mins until browned. Add __2 tsp Thai seasoning__ (see Make it yours) and cook for a further 2 mins or until the chicken is cooked through. Remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Make dressing
steps.description: Combine __1 tbs sweet chilli sauce*__, __2 tsp soy sauce__ and __2 tsp white vinegar__ in a large bowl.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Add the __noodles__, __chicken__, __cucumber__ and __mint__ to the dressing and stir to combine. Divide the __noodle salad__ among bowls and enjoy!

steps.title: Make it yours
steps.description: We've suggested this amount of Thai seasoning for flavour, but if you prefer less heat or have little ones, reduce to taste.

chef.description: Easy and simply delicious home-cooked meals that everyone will love.

name: Feed A Crowd: Mild Indian Chicken Curry
subtitle: Same Meal Price, More Servings!
name_with_subtitle: Feed A Crowd: Mild Indian Chicken Curry Same Meal Price, More Servings!
description: Want extra bang for your buck? Serve up more with our Feed A Crowd recipes. We've used the same amount of meat but added more hearty ingredients like filling carbs and veggies to satisfy hungry tummies. If you’re on a 2-person plan, these recipes make 4 portions; on a 4-person plan, they make 8 portions.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Peel the __carrots__, then halve lengthwise and thinly slice on an angle. Halve the __zucchini__ lengthwise and thinly slice. Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__. Thinly slice the __chicken__. Put the chicken, garlic, __half the curry powder__ and __2 tsp vegetable oil__ in a bowl, season with __salt and pepper__ and toss to coat.

steps.title: Cook rice
steps.description: Rinse the __rice__ until the water runs clear. Put in a medium saucepan with __450ml water__, cover and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Reduce the heat to low and cook for 12 mins or until tender and the water is absorbed. Turn off the heat and stand, covered, for at least 5 mins.

steps.title: Brown chicken
steps.description: Meanwhile, heat a large deep frypan over high heat. Cook the __chicken__, stirring occasionally, for 3-4 mins until browned. Remove from the pan. Heat __2 tsp vegetable oil__ in the pan over medium heat. Cook the __carrot__, stirring, for 2 mins. Add the __remaining curry powder__ and cook, stirring, for 1 min or until fragrant.

steps.title: Simmer curry
steps.description: Add the __chicken__, __coconut milk__ and __250ml (1 cup) water__ to the carrot mixture and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat to medium and cook for 5-7 mins until slightly reduced. Add the __zucchini__ and cook for a further 3-5 mins until the zucchini is tender and the chicken is cooked through.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Stir __1 tbs soy sauce__ and __1 tsp sugar__ into the curry. Taste, then season with __salt and pepper__. Remove the pan from the heat. Divide the __rice__ and __curry__ among bowls and enjoy!

steps.title: Feed A Crowd
steps.description: Empty out the crisper drawer and boost your veggies by adding whatever you have on hand, from broccoli and mushrooms to capsicum and beans.

chef.name: Mel Burge
chef.description: Mel loves spicy Mexican food, chicken burgers and baking for all types of occasions.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Mel brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Her passion for food and cooking began at a young age and led her to the New Idea Test Kitchen, where she developed and tested recipes over a period of 10 years. She's also worked for other major food brands including Taste, Arnott’s, Donna Hay and Perfection Fresh. Mel also specialises in cake decorating and runs a small side business in her spare time.

name: Feed A Crowd: Asian Beef Tacos
subtitle: Same Meal Price, More Servings!
name_with_subtitle: Feed A Crowd: Asian Beef Tacos Same Meal Price, More Servings!
description: Want extra bang for your buck? Serve up more with our Feed A Crowd recipes. We've used the same amount of meat but added more hearty ingredients like filling carbs and veggies to satisfy hungry tummies. If you’re on a 2-person plan, these recipes make 4 portions; on a 4-person plan, they make 8 portions.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Preheat the oven to 220C (see Feed A Crowd). Thinly slice the __onion__. Thinly slice the __cabbage__ with a mandoline or sharp knife. Peel the __carrots__, then shred using a julienne peeler or coarsely grate with a box grater. Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__.

steps.title: Warm tortillas
steps.description: Enclose the __tortillas__ in 2 foil packages. Put in the oven for 8 mins or until softened and warmed through.

steps.title: Brown beef
steps.description: Meanwhile, heat __2 tsp olive oil__ in a large deep frypan over high heat. Cook the __onion__, stirring occasionally, for 3 mins or until softened. Increase the heat to high. Add the __beef mince__ and cook, breaking up the lumps with a spoon, for 2-3 mins until browned.

steps.title: Make slaw
steps.description: Add the __garlic__, __1 tbs Thai seasoning__ (see Feed A Crowd) and __1 tbs soy sauce__ to the beef mixture and cook, stirring, for 30 secs or until combined. Remove the pan from the heat. Combine __1 tbs olive oil__ and __1 tbs white vinegar__ in a large bowl and season with __salt and pepper__. Add the __cabbage__ and __carrot__ and toss to combine.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Combine __2 tbs mayonnaise__ and __2 tsp water__ in a bowl. Divide the __slaw__ and __beef mixture__ among the __tortillas__, drizzle with the __mayonnaise__ and enjoy!

steps.title: Feed A Crowd
steps.description: We're using the oven to heat the tortillas. If you don't want to turn the oven on, use a microwave instead. Put 6 tortillas on a plate, slightly overlapping, and microwave in 10-sec bursts until warmed through. Cover to keep warm. Repeat with the remaining tortillas. ~ Thai seasoning has a chilli kick. For those who prefer less heat, use half the specified amount.

chef.name: Mel Burge
chef.description: Mel loves spicy Mexican food, chicken burgers and baking for all types of occasions.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Mel brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Her passion for food and cooking began at a young age and led her to the New Idea Test Kitchen, where she developed and tested recipes over a period of 10 years. She's also worked for other major food brands including Taste, Arnott’s, Donna Hay and Perfection Fresh. Mel also specialises in cake decorating and runs a small side business in her spare time.

name: Feed A Crowd: Vego Pesto Pasta
subtitle: Same Meal Price, More Servings!
name_with_subtitle: Feed A Crowd: Vego Pesto Pasta Same Meal Price, More Servings!
description: Want extra bang for your buck? Serve up more with our Feed A Crowd recipes. We've added more hearty ingredients like filling carbs and veggies to satisfy hungry tummies. If you’re on a 2-person plan, these recipes make 4 portions; on a 4-person plan, they make 8 portions.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Preheat the oven to 220C. Line 2 oven trays with baking paper. Bring a large saucepan of salted water to the boil for the pasta. Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__. Cut the __unpeeled sweet potatoes__ into 2cm chunks. Cut the __broccoli__ stem into 1cm chunks, then cut the head into small florets.

steps.title: Roast vegetables
steps.description: Combine the __garlic__, __3 tsp olive oil__ and __2 tsp honey__ in a bowl. Put the __sweet potato__ on a lined tray, drizzle with the __oil mixture__ and season with __salt and pepper__. Put the __broccoli__ on the remaining lined tray, drizzle with __3 tsp olive oil__ and season with __salt and pepper__. Roast the vegetables for 20-25 mins until golden and tender.

steps.title: Cook pasta
steps.description: Meanwhile, cook the __pasta__ in the pan of boiling water for 11 mins or until al dente. Reserve __180ml (¾ cup) cooking water__, then drain the pasta. Return the pasta to the pan.

steps.title: Toast almonds
steps.description: Put the __almonds__ in a cold small frypan over medium heat. Toast, tossing, for 3-4 mins until evenly golden. Remove from the pan.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Add the __reserved cooking water__, __roasted vegetables__, __pesto__ and __half the feta__ to the pasta in the pan and toss to combine. Taste, then season with __salt and pepper__. Divide the __pesto pasta__ among bowls, crumble over the __remaining feta__, scatter over the __almonds__ and enjoy!

steps.title: Feed A Crowd
steps.description: If you like, put the pasta in a big bowl in the middle of the table for everyone to help themselves. If you have some on hand, serve with some extra virgin olive oil for drizzling or lemon wedges to squeeze over.

name: Low-Cal Chimichurri Chicken
subtitle: with Roasted Broccoli and Freekeh Salad
name_with_subtitle: Low-Cal Chimichurri Chicken with Roasted Broccoli and Freekeh Salad
description: Change up your chicken routine with aromatic chimichurri spices. Freekeh studded with Craisins and roasted broccoli complete this flavour-packed, low-cal meal.

steps.title: Cook freekeh
steps.description: Preheat the oven to 220C. Fill a medium saucepan three-quarters full with water and bring to the boil. Cook the __freekeh__, partially covered, for 18-20 mins until tender. Drain.

steps.title: Roast broccoli
steps.description: Meanwhile, line an oven tray with baking paper. Thinly slice the __broccoli__ stem and cut the head into large florets. Cut the __onion__ into thick wedges. Put the broccoli stem, florets and onion on the lined tray, drizzle with __2 tsp olive oil__, season with __salt and pepper__ and toss to coat. Roast for 25 mins or until tender.

steps.title: Marinate chicken
steps.description: Crush or finely chop __1 garlic clove__. Put the garlic, __chicken__, __1 tsp chimichurri spice blend*__ (see Make it yours) and __2 tsp olive oil__ in a bowl, season with __salt and pepper__ and toss to coat.

steps.title: Pan-fry chicken
steps.description: Heat a medium frypan over medium-high heat. Cook the __chicken__ for 3-4 mins each side until browned and cooked through. Remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Put __2 tsp red wine vinegar__, __1 tsp olive oil__ and __½ tsp honey__ in a large bowl. Season with __salt and pepper__ and whisk to combine. Add the __freekeh__, __Craisins__ and __roasted broccoli and onion__ and toss to combine. Divide the __freekeh salad__ and __chicken__ among plates and enjoy!

steps.title: Make it yours
steps.description: Chimichurri has a slight chilli kick, so if you are cooking for someone who isn't keen on too much spicy heat, reserve some of the chicken from the marinade and simply season well with salt and pepper before cooking.

name: Reduced-Carb Middle Eastern Lamb
subtitle: with Cauliflower 'Rice' and Almonds
name_with_subtitle: Reduced-Carb Middle Eastern Lamb with Cauliflower 'Rice' and Almonds
description: Not only a delicious low-carb choice, cauliflower 'rice' also boosts your daily veg intake. Light and fluffy, it's a perfect base for our Middle Eastern-spiced lamb and tender zucchini ribbons.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Thinly slice the __onion__. Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__. Coarsely grate the __cauliflower__, including the stem (see Kitchen notes). Peel the __zucchini__ into ribbons with a vegetable peeler.

steps.title: Cook lamb
steps.description: Heat __2 tsp olive oil__ in a medium deep frypan over high heat. Cook the __lamb mince__, breaking up the lumps with a spoon, for 3-4 mins until browned. Add __1½ tsp harissa seasoning__ (see Kitchen notes) and __1 tbs tomato sauce__, season with __salt and pepper__ and cook, stirring, for 1 min or until fragrant. Remove from the pan and cover to keep warm.

steps.title: Cook cauliflower rice
steps.description: Heat __2 tsp olive oil__ in the same pan over medium heat. Cook the __onion__ and __garlic__, stirring, for 3 mins or until softened. Add the __cauliflower__ and cook, stirring, for 3 mins or until tender. Add __1 tsp harissa seasoning__ and cook, stirring, for 1 min or until fragrant. Taste, then season with __salt and pepper__. Remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Toast almonds
steps.description: Put the __almonds__ in a cold small frypan over medium heat. Toast, tossing, for 3-4 mins until evenly golden. Remove from the pan. Heat __2 tsp olive oil__ in the pan over medium heat. Cook the __zucchini__ for 1-2 mins until tender. Remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Divide the __cauliflower rice__ among plates and top with the __lamb__ and __zucchini__. Scatter over the __almonds__ and enjoy!

steps.title: Kitchen notes
steps.description: To speed things up, process coarsely chopped cauliflower in a food processor using the pulse button until it resembles rice. ~ Harissa is a chilli-based seasoning and has a kick to it. If you prefer less heat, reduce the seasoning to taste.

chef.name: Mel Burge
chef.description: Mel loves spicy Mexican food, chicken burgers and baking for all types of occasions.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Mel brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Her passion for food and cooking began at a young age and led her to the New Idea Test Kitchen, where she developed and tested recipes over a period of 10 years. She's also worked for other major food brands including Taste, Arnott’s, Donna Hay and Perfection Fresh. Mel also specialises in cake decorating and runs a small side business in her spare time.

name: Reduced-Carb Chinese Beef
subtitle: with Cabbage Slaw and Sticky Peanuts
name_with_subtitle: Reduced-Carb Chinese Beef with Cabbage Slaw and Sticky Peanuts
description: What's tasty, low-carb and ready in a flash? This moreish beef stir-fry with crunchy slaw and sticky peanuts – it's a winner of a dinner!

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Preheat the oven to 200C. Line an oven tray with baking paper. Thinly slice the __cabbage__ using a mandoline or sharp knife. Pick the __coriander__ leaves and finely chop the stems. Coarsely chop the __peanuts__. Peel the __carrot__, then shred using a julienne peeler or coarsely grate with a box grater.

steps.title: Roast peanuts
steps.description: Put the __peanuts__ on the lined tray, drizzle with __1 tsp honey__, season lightly with __salt__ and toss to coat. Roast for 5-6 mins until caramelised.

steps.title: Marinate beef
steps.description: Meanwhile, separate the __beef stir-fry__ into a bowl. Add the __coriander stems__ and __Chinese barbecue seasoning__, season with __pepper__ and toss well to combine. Put __2 tbs mayonnaise__, __1 tsp white vinegar__ and __2 tsp water__ in a large bowl. Season with __salt and pepper__ and whisk to combine.

steps.title: Stir-fry beef
steps.description: Heat __1 tbs vegetable oil__ in a medium frypan over high heat until very hot (see Kitchen 101). Stir-fry the __beef__ for 1-2 mins until browned. Remove from the pan. Add __80ml (⅓ cup) water__ to the pan and cook for 2 mins or until slightly reduced. Stir in the beef, then remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Coarsely chop the __caramelised peanuts__. Add the __cabbage__, __carrot__ and __coriander leaves__ to the mayonnaise dressing and gently toss to combine. Divide the __slaw__ among plates, top with the __beef__, scatter over the peanuts and enjoy!

steps.title: Kitchen 101
steps.description: Ensuring the pan is really hot before adding the beef prevents it from stewing and gives it a nice browned finish.

chef.name: Charlotte Binns-McDonald
chef.description: Marley Spoon Development Chef Charlotte Binns-McDonald culinary ethos is centred on simplicity, modernity and a clever, creative edge and she brings all of these elements, and more, to her work in our test kitchen.
chef.bio: Marley Spoon Development, Chef Charlotte Binns-McDonald, worked with major orchestras at the Sydney Opera House before deciding to properly pursue her love for food by training as a chef. Since then, she's worked on titles for The Australian Women's Weekly, honing her developing and testing skills in the vaunted AWW test kitchen; she's also contributed to various magazine titles and worked on food production for leading TV shows. Before joining Marley Spoon, Charlotte was the Food Editor at Delicious magazine, one of Australia's most prestigious food editorial roles.

name: Southern-Style Plant-Based Enchiladas
subtitle: with Spring Onion Salsa
name_with_subtitle: Southern-Style Plant-Based Enchiladas with Spring Onion Salsa
description: Dare we say this is the whole enchilada... because it is! It's made using plant-based mince, so it's great for vegetarians and flexitarians alike, and there's lots of smoky barbecue flavours in the sauce. Plus, it's cheesy!

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Preheat the oven to 220C. Crush or finely chop __1 garlic clove__. Thinly slice the __onion__. Finely chop the __tomato__. Thinly slice the __spring onion__ on an angle. Coarsely grate the __cheese__. Combine __1 tbs barbecue sauce__, __1 tbs tomato paste__ and __375ml (1½ cups) water__ in a bowl.

steps.title: Brown plant-based mince
steps.description: Heat __1 tbs olive oil__ in a medium frypan over medium-high heat. Cook the __garlic__, __onion__, __plant-based mince__ and __barbecue seasoning__, breaking up the lumps with a spoon, for 4 mins or until browned. Scatter over __2 tsp plain flour__ and cook, stirring, for 1 min.

steps.title: Simmer sauce
steps.description: Add the __barbecue sauce mixture__ to the mince and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat to low and cook, stirring occasionally, for 5-6 mins until thickened. Taste, then season with __salt and pepper__. Remove the pan from the heat. Put the __mince mixture__ in a sieve over a bowl to drain, reserving the liquid.

steps.title: Assemble enchiladas
steps.description: Spread the __reserved liquid__ over the base of a medium baking dish (see Kitchen 101). Divide the __mince mixture__ among the __tortillas__ and roll to enclose, then put in the dish, seam side down.

steps.title: Bake and serve up
steps.description: Scatter over the __cheese__ and season with __salt and pepper__. Bake for 8-10 mins until the cheese is golden and the enchiladas are warmed through. Scatter over the __tomato__ and __spring onion__, then divide among plates and enjoy!

steps.title: Kitchen 101
steps.description: You will need a dish large enough to fit the length of the tortillas – about 17cm x 26cm. Before filling and rolling them, trim the ends of the tortillas, if needed, to fit the dish.

chef.name: Yasmin and Dinnerly Team
chef.description: Easy and simply delicious home-cooked meals that everyone will love.
chef.bio:
Yasmin's passion for food began at a young age, watching on as her mum and dad cooked in the home kitchen and tasting global cuisines as her family travelled the world. Since then, her impressive career has spanned magazines, television and radio with a roll call of Australian brands. Yasmin is also the author of two best-selling books, 7000 Islands: Cherished Recipes and Stories from the Philippines, and The Desserts of New York (And How to Eat Them All), which combine her love of food and travel.

Yasmin and the talented Dinnerly team of recipe developers, including Jane Howard and Louise Pickford, hope we've made dinnertime that much easier, tastier, quicker and more fun for you and your family. Enjoy!

name: Balanced Tofu and Spinach Saag
subtitle: with Lentils and Red Rice
name_with_subtitle: Balanced Tofu and Spinach Saag with Lentils and Red Rice
description: Our vegan take on saag paneer uses satay tofu in place of Indian cottage cheese. Spinach is still front and centre, with nourishing lentils added to the mix. Serve with nutrient-rich red rice.

steps.title: Cook rice
steps.description: Fill a medium saucepan three-quarters full with water and bring to the boil. Add the __rice__ and cook for 25 mins or until tender. Drain.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Meanwhile, finely chop the __onion__ and __tomatoes__. Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__. Drain and rinse the __lentils__. Heat __2 tsp vegetable oil__ in a medium deep frypan over medium heat. Cook the __tofu__ for 2 mins each side or until golden. Remove from the pan and cut into 2cm chunks.

steps.title: Start curry
steps.description: Heat __2 tsp vegetable oil__ in the same pan over medium-high heat. Cook the __onion__, stirring, for 3 mins or until softened. Add the __garlic__ and __masala seasoning__ and cook, stirring, for 1 min or until fragrant. Add the __tomato__ and cook, stirring, for 3 mins or until softened.

steps.title: Simmer curry
steps.description: Add __half the lentils*__ and __180ml (¾ cup) water__ to the tomato mixture. Season with __salt and pepper__ and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat to medium and cook for 8 mins or until slightly thickened.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Add the __spinach__ and __tofu__ to the curry and cook for 2-3 mins until the spinach is wilted and the tofu is warmed through. Remove the pan from the heat. Taste, then season with __salt and pepper__. Divide the __rice__ and __curry__ among bowls. Enjoy!

steps.title: Make it yours
steps.description: Like your curries hot? Kick up the heat a notch or two with a scattering of chopped fresh chilli or dried chilli flakes.

chef.name: Bree Hutchins
chef.description: Bree loves nutritious plant-based recipes, global cuisines and cooking for celebrations.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Bree brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Criminal lawyer turned food photographer and recipe developer, Bree has eaten her way across six continents, invited herself into countless kitchens and gathered recipes from around the globe. She’s written, styled and photographed her own cookbooks, contributed to titles for leading Australian publishers and founded a start-up that sells plant-based remakes of classic treats.

name: Low-Cal Spicy Mushroom Salad
subtitle: with Parsnips and Yoghurt
name_with_subtitle: Low-Cal Spicy Mushroom Salad with Parsnips and Yoghurt
description: Embrace autumn's bounty with this hearty salad of pan-fried mushrooms and sweet roasted parsnip, flavoured with chimichurri.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Preheat the oven to 220C. Line an oven tray with baking paper. Bring a small saucepan of water to the boil for the eggs. Peel the __parsnips__ and quarter lengthwise. Halve the __mushrooms__ and quarter any large ones. Crush __1 garlic clove__ (see Kitchen 101).

steps.title: Roast parsnip and walnuts
steps.description: Put the __parsnip__ on the lined tray, drizzle with __2 tsp olive oil__ and scatter over __¾ tsp chimichurri spice blend__. Season with __salt and pepper__ and toss to coat. Roast for 20 mins or until just tender. Scatter the __walnuts__ over the parsnip, toss to combine and roast for a further 5 mins or until the parsnip is tender and the walnuts are golden.

steps.title: Boil eggs
steps.description: Meanwhile, cook __2 eggs__ in the pan of boiling water for 6 mins for soft-boiled or 8 mins for hard-boiled. Drain, then cool in cold water. Peel and halve the eggs. Combine the __yoghurt__, __half the garlic__, __¼ tsp chimichurri spice blend__, __1 tsp white wine vinegar__ and __1 tsp water__ in a bowl.

steps.title: Cook mushrooms
steps.description: Heat __1 tbs olive oil__ in a medium frypan over medium-high heat. Cook the __mushrooms__, __remaining chimichurri spice blend__ and __remaining garlic__, stirring, for 3 mins or until golden. Season with __salt and pepper__. Remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Put the __rocket__, __parsnip__, __walnuts__, __mushrooms__ and any cooking juices in a bowl, season with __salt and pepper__ and toss to combine. Divide the __salad__ among plates, top with the __egg__ and drizzle with the __yoghurt dressing__. Enjoy!

steps.title: Kitchen 101
steps.description: Garlic used raw needs to be finely minced. If you don't have a garlic crusher, adding a little salt to the garlic on the chopping board helps.

assumed_ingredients.name: 1 tsp white or red wine vinegar

chef.name: Bree Hutchins
chef.description: Bree loves nutritious plant-based recipes, global cuisines and cooking for celebrations.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Bree brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Criminal lawyer turned food photographer and recipe developer, Bree has eaten her way across six continents, invited herself into countless kitchens and gathered recipes from around the globe. She’s written, styled and photographed her own cookbooks, contributed to titles for leading Australian publishers and founded a start-up that sells plant-based remakes of classic treats.

name: June Slow Cooker Special!
subtitle: Pot-Roast Chicken Marylands with Root Veggies
name_with_subtitle: June Slow Cooker Special! Pot-Roast Chicken Marylands with Root Veggies
description: Warm up this winter with our special recipes made for your slow cooker! You can also make this recipe in your oven using an ovenproof dish with a lid. For our June Slow Cooker Special, this comforting pot-roast chicken delivers on all fronts. Beat the chill and treat your tastebuds all at once with succulent chicken and earthy root veggies.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Get out your slow cooker, or if you don't have one, preheat the oven to 220C. Cut the unpeeled __potato__ into 4cm chunks. Cut the unpeeled __carrot__ into 1.5cm-thick slices. Cut the __celery__ into 7cm lengths. Peel __2 garlic cloves__, keeping them whole. Put __1 tbs country seasoning__ in a heatproof jug, add __500ml (2 cups) boiling water__ and stir to dissolve.

steps.title: Brown chicken
steps.description: Combine the __remaining country seasoning__ and __2 tbs olive oil__ in a large shallow dish. Add the __chicken__, season with __salt and pepper__ and turn to coat. Heat a medium frypan (if using a slow cooker) or a medium flameproof casserole dish over medium-high heat. Cook the chicken, turning occasionally, for 5 mins or until browned.

steps.title: Slow cooker method
steps.description: If using the slow cooker, add the __chicken and pan juices__, __potato__, __carrot__, __celery__, __garlic cloves__ and __stock__ to the slow cooker bowl (see Kitchen 101). Cover and cook on low for 8 hours.

steps.title: Casserole dish method
steps.description: If using the casserole dish, add the __potato__, __carrot__, __celery__, __garlic cloves__ and __stock__ to the chicken and bring to the boil. Transfer the dish to the oven and bake, covered, for 20 mins or until the veggies are almost tender and the chicken is cooked through. Remove the lid and bake for a further 10 mins or until the meat starts to fall away from the bones.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: For both versions, taste, then season with __salt and pepper__. Divide the __chicken__ and __veggies__ among plates or pop the dish on the table and let everyone help themselves. Enjoy!

steps.title: Kitchen 101
steps.description: Make sure the chicken and veggies are covered in the stock or they won't cook properly. If necessary, push them down in the cooker so they are submerged in the liquid.

assumed_cooking_utilities.name: 3.5L electric slow cooker or medium flameproof casserole dish with lid
medium frypan (if using the slow cooker)

chef.name: Bree Hutchins
chef.description: Bree loves nutritious plant-based recipes, global cuisines and cooking for celebrations.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Bree brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Criminal lawyer turned food photographer and recipe developer, Bree has eaten her way across six continents, invited herself into countless kitchens and gathered recipes from around the globe. She’s written, styled and photographed her own cookbooks, contributed to titles for leading Australian publishers and founded a start-up that sells plant-based remakes of classic treats.

cooking_tip: The prep and cook time listed above is for the casserole dish method. If using the slow cooker, the prep and cook time is around 8¼ hrs.

name: June Dessert Special!
subtitle: Sticky Date Puddings with Butterscotch Sauce
name_with_subtitle: June Dessert Special! Sticky Date Puddings with Butterscotch Sauce
description: Kiss the winter blues goodbye with our super-easy mini sticky date puddings. Simply make and bake the batter, then pop your puds into a bowl, bathe in a blanket of lush, warm butterscotch sauce and dig in. One taste and you'll wish it was winter all year round!

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Put the cream in the fridge for a few hours to chill (see Kitchen notes). Preheat the oven to 180C. Chop __75g butter__, then put in a bowl to soften. Put the __dates__, __baking powder__ and __180ml (¾ cup) boiling water__ in a heatproof bowl and stir to combine. Stand for 10 mins or until softened. Grease a 12-hole muffin pan.

steps.title: Make batter
steps.description: Transfer the __date mixture__ to a food processor (see Kitchen notes). Add the __softened butter__ and __110g (½ cup) brown sugar__ and process until combined. Add __150g (1 cup) flour__ and __2 eggs__ and process until just combined.

steps.title: Bake puddings
steps.description: Divide the __batter__ evenly among the muffin holes. Bake the __puddings__ for 20-25 mins until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 5 mins.

steps.title: Make butterscotch sauce
steps.description: Meanwhile, put __50g butter*__, __110g (½ cup) brown sugar__ and __125ml (½ cup) cream__ in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook, stirring, for 2-3 mins until the butter melts and the sugar dissolves. Bring to the boil, then remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Whisk the __remaining chilled cream__ in a bowl until soft peaks form. Divide the __warm puddings__ among bowls, drizzle over the __butterscotch sauce__ and top with the __whipped cream__. Enjoy! __Makes 12 (2 puddings per serve)__.

steps.title: Kitchen notes
steps.description: Our cream can live either in the fridge or in the pantry, but to ensure it whips easily and holds its shape, chill before use. ~ If using a stick blender, transfer the ingredients into a large, deep bowl.

chef.name: Bree Hutchins
chef.description: Bree loves nutritious plant-based recipes, global cuisines and cooking for celebrations.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Bree brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Criminal lawyer turned food photographer and recipe developer, Bree has eaten her way across six continents, invited herself into countless kitchens and gathered recipes from around the globe. She’s written, styled and photographed her own cookbooks, contributed to titles for leading Australian publishers and founded a start-up that sells plant-based remakes of classic treats.

cooking_tip: Baked goods like puddings turn out best with extra love and care, so read through the recipe first and measure out the ingredients with kitchen scales or measuring cups in each step.

name: June Dessert Special!
subtitle: Apple and Rhubarb Crumble with Orange Cream
name_with_subtitle: June Dessert Special! Apple and Rhubarb Crumble with Orange Cream
description: Nothing screams comfort food more than a classic crumble. With a base of winter fruit – think apples and ruby-red rhubarb – and an oaty, almond-studded topping, this is a 'socks on, curl up on the couch' dessert.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Put the cream in the fridge for a few hours to chill (see Kitchen notes). Chop __30g butter__ and chill until required. Preheat the oven to 180C. Peel and core the __apples__, then cut into 1.5cm-thick wedges. Cut the __rhubarb__ into 6cm lengths. Finely grate the __orange__ zest, then juice.

steps.title: Cook fruit
steps.description: Put the __apple__, __rhubarb__, __orange juice__, __half the orange zest__, __110g (½ cup) caster sugar__ and __60ml (¼ cup) water__ in a medium deep ovenproof frypan (see Kitchen notes) over high heat and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover and cook, stirring occasionally, for 3-4 mins until the fruit is softened. Remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Make crumble topping
steps.description: Meanwhile, combine the __oats__, __almonds__, __55g (¼ cup) caster sugar__, __1 tsp mixed spice*__ and __1 tbs plain flour__ in a large bowl. Add the __chilled butter__. Using your fingertips, rub the butter into the oat mixture until it resembles coarse breadcrumbs.

steps.title: Bake crumble
steps.description: Sprinkle the __crumble topping__ over the fruit mixture in the pan (don't worry if it doesn't completely cover the fruit). Bake the __crumble__ for 30-35 mins until golden and bubbling.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Meanwhile, whisk the __chilled cream__ and __1 tbs caster sugar*__ in a bowl until soft peaks form. Stir in the __remaining orange zest__. Serve the __warm crumble__ with the __whipped orange cream__ and enjoy! __Serves 3-4__.

steps.title: Kitchen notes
steps.description: Our cream can live either in the fridge or in the pantry, but to ensure it whips easily and holds its shape, chill before use. ~ Don’t have an ovenproof frypan? Use a regular medium deep frypan, then transfer to a 1L (4 cup) baking dish to bake.

assumed_cooking_utilities.name: medium deep ovenproof frypan with lid (optional)

chef.name: Bree Hutchins
chef.description: Bree loves nutritious plant-based recipes, global cuisines and cooking for celebrations.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Bree brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Criminal lawyer turned food photographer and recipe developer, Bree has eaten her way across six continents, invited herself into countless kitchens and gathered recipes from around the globe. She’s written, styled and photographed her own cookbooks, contributed to titles for leading Australian publishers and founded a start-up that sells plant-based remakes of classic treats.

name: June Brunch Special!
subtitle: Coconut and Caramelised Banana Porridge
name_with_subtitle: June Brunch Special! Coconut and Caramelised Banana Porridge
description: With tropical flavours of caramelised banana and coconut set against a creamy porridge backdrop, this warming bowl of goodness is the  ultimate winter breakfast or brunch. Better yet, it's on the table in 20 minutes and, because it's made with coconut milk instead of regular milk, it's vegan too.

steps.title: Toast coconut
steps.description: Put __half the coconut__ in a cold medium frypan over medium heat. Toast, tossing, for 3-4 mins until evenly golden. Remove from the pan, reserving the pan.

steps.title: Start porridge
steps.description: Combine the __oats__, __half the coconut water*__, __remaining coconut__ and a __pinch of salt__ in a medium saucepan over high heat and bring to the boil.

steps.title: Simmer porridge
steps.description: Reduce the heat to medium-low and cook, stirring regularly, for 8-10 mins until thick and creamy (see Kitchen 101). Stir in __160ml (⅔ cup) coconut milk__. Remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Caramelise banana
steps.description: Meanwhile, halve the __bananas__ lengthwise. Heat __2 tsp olive oil__ in the reserved pan over medium heat. Cook the banana, turning, for 2-3 mins until caramelised. Remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Divide the __porridge__ among bowls and top with the __caramelised banana__ and __toasted coconut__. Drizzle with the __maple syrup__ and __remaining coconut milk__. Enjoy!

steps.title: Kitchen 101
steps.description: If the porridge is becoming too thick before it's fully cooked, stir in a little more coconut water.

chef.name: Bree Hutchins
chef.description: Bree loves nutritious plant-based recipes, global cuisines and cooking for celebrations.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Bree brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Criminal lawyer turned food photographer and recipe developer, Bree has eaten her way across six continents, invited herself into countless kitchens and gathered recipes from around the globe. She’s written, styled and photographed her own cookbooks, contributed to titles for leading Australian publishers and founded a start-up that sells plant-based remakes of classic treats.

name: Fig and Garlic Bread-Stuffed Chicken
subtitle: with Roasted Carrots and Kale Salad
name_with_subtitle: Fig and Garlic Bread-Stuffed Chicken with Roasted Carrots and Kale Salad
description: Although this scrumptious roast takes a bit more time and effort than a regular Dinnerly dinner, we think it's worth it. Fig-stuffed chicken, sweet roasted carrots and a healthy kale salad are destined to impress!

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Preheat the oven to 220C. Line 2 oven trays with baking paper. Lightly grease a 1.5L (6 cup) baking dish. Put __20g butter__ in a bowl to soften. Peel the __carrots__ and quarter lengthwise. Remove the tough inner stems from the __kale__, then coarsely chop the leaves. Tear __½ garlic ciabatta__ into coarse breadcrumbs, then cut the __remaining 1½ garlic ciabatta__ into 1cm chunks.

steps.title: Stuff chicken
steps.description: Combine the __breadcrumbs__, __half the dried figs__ and __half the butter__ in a bowl and season with __salt and pepper__. Put the __chicken breast__ flat on a board, put your hand on top and halve horizontally into 2 equal fillets. Spread the __fig stuffing__ across the centre of each, then roll to enclose and secure with toothpicks. Put the chicken, seam side down, in the baking dish.

steps.title: Roast chicken and carrot
steps.description: Drizzle the __chicken__ with __2 tsp olive oil__ and season with __salt and pepper__. Put the __carrot__ on a lined tray, dot with the __remaining butter,__ drizzle with __1 tsp honey__ and season with __salt and pepper__. Roast the chicken on the upper oven shelf and the carrot on the lower shelf for 20 mins.

steps.title: Make dressing
steps.description: Add the __sunflower seeds__ to the tray with the carrot and roast for a further 5 mins or until the chicken is cooked through, the carrot is tender and the sunflower seeds are golden. Meanwhile, put __1 tbs olive oil__, __1 tbs white wine vinegar__ and __1 tsp honey__ in a large bowl, season with __salt and pepper__ and whisk to combine. Stir in the __remaining dried figs__.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Put the __bread__ on the remaining lined tray and bake for 5-7 mins until golden and crisp. Meanwhile, add the __kale__ to the dressing and massage for 1 min or until tender (see Kitchen 101). Add the __croutons__ to the salad and toss to combine. Divide the __chicken__, __carrot__ and __salad__ among plates. Scatter over the __sunflower seeds__, drizzle with the pan juices and enjoy!

steps.title: Kitchen 101
steps.description: Yes, you read it correctly – kale needs to be massaged! This helps to break down the tough fibres, making it tender and easier to eat. Gently pinch and squeeze the leaves until they start to shrink, soften and darken a little.

name: Fan Fave: Lamb Kofta Burgers
subtitle: with Creamy Olives and Mixed Salad
name_with_subtitle: Fan Fave: Lamb Kofta Burgers with Creamy Olives and Mixed Salad
description: Tuck into moreish lamb burgers flavoured with fragrant Middle Eastern spices and teamed with a carrot salad. Top things off with a creamy, chopped olive sauce.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Peel the __carrot__, then shred using a julienne peeler or coarsely grate with a box grater. Coarsely chop the __olives__. Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__. Put the __lamb mince__, __kofta seasoning__ and garlic in a bowl and season with __salt and pepper__. Using damp hands, combine well, then shape into 2 equal patties, slightly larger than the base of a bread roll.

steps.title: Pan-fry patties
steps.description: Preheat the grill to high. Heat __2 tsp olive oil__ in a medium frypan over medium-high heat. Cook the __patties__ for 3-4 mins each side until cooked through. Remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Grill bread rolls
steps.description: Meanwhile, cut the __bread rolls__ in half. Put on an oven tray, cut side up, and grill for 3-4 mins until lightly toasted.

steps.title: Make salad
steps.description: Put __2 tsp olive oil__, __2 tsp red wine vinegar__ and __1 tsp honey__ in a large bowl, season with __salt and pepper__ and whisk to combine. Add the __salad leaves__ and __carrot__ and toss to coat. Combine the __olives__ and __2 tbs mayonnaise__ in a separate bowl (see Make it yours).

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Layer the __bread roll__ bases with __half the salad__, the __lamb patties__ and __olive mayonnaise__, then sandwich with the tops. Serve with the __remaining salad__ and enjoy!

steps.title: Make it yours
steps.description: Not a fan of olives? Simply leave them out and serve with plain mayonnaise or a sauce of your choice.

assumed_ingredients.name: 2 tsp red or white wine vinegar

chef.name: Mel Burge
chef.description: Mel loves spicy Mexican food, chicken burgers and baking for all types of occasions.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Mel brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Her passion for food and cooking began at a young age and led her to the New Idea Test Kitchen, where she developed and tested recipes over a period of 10 years. She's also worked for other major food brands including Taste, Arnott’s, Donna Hay and Perfection Fresh. Mel also specialises in cake decorating and runs a small side business in her spare time.

name: Mint and Rosemary Beef Meatballs
subtitle: with Pasta
name_with_subtitle: Mint and Rosemary Beef Meatballs with Pasta
description: Meatballs and pasta are a heavenly match. Roll herby beef mince into mini meatballs, simmer in a rich tomato sauce and spoon over twirly pasta. Buon appetito!

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Bring a medium saucepan of salted water to the boil for the pasta (see Kitchen note). Finely chop the __onion__. Peel the __carrot__ and cut into 1cm chunks. Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__. Put the __beef mince__ and __half the mint and rosemary seasoning__ in a bowl and season with __salt and pepper__. Using damp hands, combine well, then shape into walnut-sized balls.

steps.title: Cook pasta
steps.description: Cook __three-quarters of the pasta*__ in the pan of boiling water for 12 mins or until al dente. Reserve __125ml (½ cup) cooking water__, then drain the pasta.

steps.title: Brown meatballs
steps.description: Meanwhile, heat __2 tsp olive oil__ in a medium deep frypan over medium-high heat. Cook the __meatballs__, turning, for 4-6 mins until browned. Remove from the pan. Heat __2 tsp olive oil__ in the same pan over medium-high heat. Cook the __onion__, __carrot__ and __garlic__, stirring, for 2 mins or until starting to soften.

steps.title: Simmer sauce
steps.description: Add the __tomatoes__, __remaining mint and rosemary seasoning__, __reserved cooking water__, __1 tbs tomato paste__ and __2 tsp  sugar__ to the veggies. Season with __salt and pepper__ and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low, add the __meatballs__ and cook, covered, for 3 mins. Remove the lid and cook for a further 2 mins or until the meatballs are cooked through.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Taste the sauce, then season with __salt and pepper__. Remove the pan from the heat. Divide the __pasta__ and __meatballs and sauce__ among bowls and enjoy!

steps.title: Kitchen note
steps.description: We've substituted spaghetti for the tagliatelle pictured due to availability. Don't worry, the dish will be just as delicious!

name: Teriyaki Chicken Sushi Bowl
subtitle: with Red Cabbage and Cucumber
name_with_subtitle: Teriyaki Chicken Sushi Bowl with Red Cabbage and Cucumber
description: Golden teriyaki chicken, tangy cucumber and cabbage salad, plus sesame-flecked rice: it's everything you love about sushi in one bursting bowl!

steps.title: Cook rice
steps.description: Rinse the __rice__ until the water runs clear. Put in a small saucepan with __250ml (1 cup) water__, cover and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Reduce the heat to low and cook for 12 mins or until tender and the water is absorbed. Turn off the heat and stand, covered, for at least 5 mins.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Meanwhile, thinly slice the __cabbage__ with a sharp knife or mandoline (see Kitchen 101). Halve the __cucumber__ lengthwise, then thinly slice on an angle. Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__. Thinly slice the __chicken__. Put the chicken, garlic and __half the teriyaki sauce__ in a bowl, season with __salt and pepper__ and toss to coat.

steps.title: Toss salad
steps.description: Meanwhile, combine __2 tsp vegetable oil__, __1 tbs white vinegar__ and __2 tsp sugar__ in a bowl and season with __salt and pepper__. Add the __cabbage__ and __cucumber__ and toss to combine.

steps.title: Stir-fry chicken
steps.description: Heat __2 tsp vegetable oil__ in a medium frypan over medium-high heat. Stir-fry the __chicken__ for 3-4 mins until cooked through. Add the __remaining teriyaki sauce__ and bring to the boil. Remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Stir __half the sesame seeds__ into the rice. Divide the __sesame rice__, __chicken__ and __salad__ among bowls. Scatter over the __remaining sesame seeds__ and enjoy!

steps.title: Kitchen 101
steps.description: Get super-thin cabbage with a mandoline or use slow, fine strokes with a large sharp knife. The result is perfect for salad – light, crisp and easy to eat.

chef.name: Mel Burge
chef.description: Mel loves spicy Mexican food, chicken burgers and baking for all types of occasions.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Mel brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Her passion for food and cooking began at a young age and led her to the New Idea Test Kitchen, where she developed and tested recipes over a period of 10 years. She's also worked for other major food brands including Taste, Arnott’s, Donna Hay and Perfection Fresh. Mel also specialises in cake decorating and runs a small side business in her spare time.

name: Javanese Roast Chicken
subtitle: with Potatoes and Pickled Veggies
name_with_subtitle: Javanese Roast Chicken with Potatoes and Pickled Veggies
description: Midweek dining has never been easier. Simply marinate chicken in our aromatic Indonesian spice paste, then make a quick pickle while it roasts in the oven with some spuds. Hey presto, delicious dinner is served!

steps.title: Roast potato
steps.description: Preheat the oven to 220C. Line an oven tray with baking paper. Cut the __unpeeled potato__ into 1cm-thick rounds. Put on the lined tray, drizzle with __1 tbs vegetable oil__, season with __salt and pepper__ and toss to coat. Roast for 15 mins.

steps.title: Marinate chicken
steps.description: Meanwhile, combine __half the ayam goreng paste*__ (see Make it yours), __2 tsp vegetable oil__, __2 tsp soy sauce__, __2 tsp white vinegar__ and __2 tsp sugar__ in a large bowl. Cut the __chicken__ into 1cm-thick strips, add to the marinade and toss to coat.

steps.title: Make pickles
steps.description: Thinly slice the __cucumber__. Peel the __carrot__, then shred using a julienne peeler or coarsely grate with a box grater. Thinly slice __half the onion*__. Put __1 tbs white vinegar__ and __1 tsp sugar__ in a large bowl, season with __salt__ and stir to combine. Add the cucumber, carrot and onion and toss well to coat. Set aside to pickle, tossing occasionally, until needed.

steps.title: Roast chicken
steps.description: Put the __chicken__ on top of the potato and roast for a further 10-12 mins until the chicken is cooked through and the potato is tender.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Drain the __pickled veggies__, discarding the pickling liquid. Divide the __chicken__, __potato__ and pickles among plates. Enjoy!

steps.title: Make it yours
steps.description: We've suggested this amount of ayam goreng paste for flavour, but feel free to reduce to taste if you prefer less heat, or use it all if you like punchier flavours.

chef.name: Mel Burge
chef.description: Mel loves spicy Mexican food, chicken burgers and baking for all types of occasions.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Mel brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Her passion for food and cooking began at a young age and led her to the New Idea Test Kitchen, where she developed and tested recipes over a period of 10 years. She's also worked for other major food brands including Taste, Arnott’s, Donna Hay and Perfection Fresh. Mel also specialises in cake decorating and runs a small side business in her spare time.

name: Smoky Barbecue Beef Tacos
subtitle: with Spinach and Fresh Tomato
name_with_subtitle: Smoky Barbecue Beef Tacos with Spinach and Fresh Tomato
description: Layer warm tortillas with fresh spinach, smoky barbecue beef and juicy tomato for a family-friendly dinnertime fiesta.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Preheat the oven to 220C. Thinly slice the __onion__. Cut the __tomato__ into 1cm chunks.

steps.title: Warm tortillas
steps.description: Enclose the __tortillas__ in foil (see Make it yours). Put in the oven for 8 mins or until softened and warmed through.

steps.title: Cook beef filling
steps.description: Meanwhile, heat __2 tsp olive oil__ in a medium frypan over medium heat. Cook the __onion__, stirring occasionally, for 3 mins or until softened. Increase the heat to high, add the __beef mince__ and cook, breaking up the lumps with a spoon, for 3-4 mins until browned. Add the __barbecue seasoning__ and __1 tbs barbecue sauce__ and cook, stirring, for 1 min or until fragrant.

steps.title: Dress spinach
steps.description: Put __1 tsp olive oil__ and __1 tsp red wine vinegar__ in a large bowl and season with __salt and pepper__. Add the __spinach__ and toss to combine. Put __2 tbs mayonnaise__ and __2 tsp water__ in a separate bowl, season with __salt and pepper__ and stir to combine.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Divide the __tortillas__ among plates. Top with the __dressed spinach__, __beef filling__ and __tomato__. Drizzle with the __mayonnaise mixture__ and enjoy!

steps.title: Make it yours
steps.description: Feel like crunchy tacos instead? Don't worry about pre-warming the tortillas, simply top them with the spinach and beef, then fold over to enclose. Bake for 10-12 mins until browned. Drizzle with the mayo, then scatter over the tomato to serve.

chef.name: Mel Burge
chef.description: Mel loves spicy Mexican food, chicken burgers and baking for all types of occasions.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Mel brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Her passion for food and cooking began at a young age and led her to the New Idea Test Kitchen, where she developed and tested recipes over a period of 10 years. She's also worked for other major food brands including Taste, Arnott’s, Donna Hay and Perfection Fresh. Mel also specialises in cake decorating and runs a small side business in her spare time.

name: Smoky Tomato Gnocchi
subtitle: with Feta and Peas
name_with_subtitle: Smoky Tomato Gnocchi with Feta and Peas
description: Soft pillows of gnocchi coated in a cheesy smoked paprika and tomato sauce – it's hard to resist! Ramp up the flavour factor with fresh oregano and extra feta to finish.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Bring a large saucepan of salted water to the boil for the gnocchi (see Kitchen 101). Finely chop the __onion__. Crush or finely chop __1 garlic clove__. Pick the __oregano__ leaves, discarding the stems.

steps.title: Cook gnocchi
steps.description: Add the __gnocchi__ to the pan of boiling water, stir to separate, then return to the boil and cook for 2 mins. Add the __peas__ and cook for a further 2 mins or until the peas are tender and the gnocchi float to the surface. Reserve __250ml (1 cup) cooking water__, then drain the gnocchi and peas.

steps.title: Start sauce
steps.description: Heat __1 tbs olive oil__ in a medium deep frypan over medium-high heat. Cook the __onion__ and __garlic__, stirring, for 3 mins or until softened. Add __1 tsp smoked paprika*__ and __1 tbs tomato paste__ and cook, stirring, for a further 2 mins or until fragrant.

steps.title: Finish sauce
steps.description: Reduce the heat to low. Add __1 tbs plain flour__ to the onion mixture and cook, stirring, for 1 min. Stirring constantly, slowly add the __reserved cooking water__ and __60ml (¼ cup) milk__. Cook, stirring, for 2-3 mins until the sauce is smooth and slightly thickened. Remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Crumble __three-quarters of the feta__ into the sauce. Add the __gnocchi and peas__ and stir to combine and warm through. Taste, then season with __salt and pepper__. Divide the __gnocchi__ among bowls, top with the __remaining feta__, scatter over the __oregano__ and enjoy!

steps.title: Kitchen 101
steps.description: Make sure the water is at a rapid boil before adding the gnocchi to prevent them becoming soggy.

chef.name: Yasmin and Dinnerly Team
chef.description: Easy and simply delicious home-cooked meals that everyone will love.
chef.bio:
Yasmin's passion for food began at a young age, watching on as her mum and dad cooked in the home kitchen and tasting global cuisines as her family travelled the world. Since then, her impressive career has spanned magazines, television and radio with a roll call of Australian brands. Yasmin is also the author of two best-selling books, 7000 Islands: Cherished Recipes and Stories from the Philippines, and The Desserts of New York (And How to Eat Them All), which combine her love of food and travel.

Yasmin and the talented Dinnerly team of recipe developers, including Jane Howard and Louise Pickford, hope we've made dinnertime that much easier, tastier, quicker and more fun for you and your family. Enjoy!

name: Haloumi Tray Bake
subtitle: with Chermoula Veggies and Mint
name_with_subtitle: Haloumi Tray Bake with Chermoula Veggies and Mint
description: Toss potato, beetroot and tomato in chermoula oil, then top with haloumi and bake until golden. With the oven doing most of the work, it gives you time to put up your feet and relax.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Preheat the oven to 220C. Line an oven tray with baking paper. Cut the __unpeeled potatoes__ into 4cm chunks. Peel the __beetroot__, then cut into 1cm-thick wedges (see Kitchen 101). Cut the __tomato__ into wedges. Pick the __mint__ leaves, discarding the stems. Halve the __haloumi__ lengthwise, then cut into 1cm-thick chunks.

steps.title: Make chermoula oil
steps.description: Put the __chermoula seasoning__, __2 tbs olive oil__, __1 tsp red wine vinegar__ and __2 tsp honey__ in a large bowl. Season with __salt and pepper__ and stir to combine.

steps.title: Roast veggies
steps.description: Put the __potato__ and __beetroot__ on the lined tray, drizzle with __half the chermoula oil__ and toss to coat. Roast for 20-25 mins until tender.

steps.title: Add tomato and haloumi
steps.description: Add the __tomato__ and __haloumi__ to the __remaining chermoula oil__ and toss to coat. Add to the tray with the __potato and beetroot__. Roast for a further 8-10 mins until the haloumi is golden.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Scatter the __mint leaves__ over the __haloumi tray bake__. Divide among plates or pop the tray on the table for everyone to help themselves. Enjoy!

steps.title: Kitchen 101
steps.description: Beetroot can be messy to prepare, so wear a pair of disposable gloves to prevent your hands from turning pink.

assumed_ingredients.name: 1 tsp red or white wine vinegar

chef.name: Bree Hutchins
chef.description: Bree loves nutritious plant-based recipes, global cuisines and cooking for celebrations.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Bree brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Criminal lawyer turned food photographer and recipe developer, Bree has eaten her way across six continents, invited herself into countless kitchens and gathered recipes from around the globe. She’s written, styled and photographed her own cookbooks, contributed to titles for leading Australian publishers and founded a start-up that sells plant-based remakes of classic treats.

name: Knife-and-Fork Pork Meatball Subs
subtitle: with Spinach and Crunchy Seeds
name_with_subtitle: Knife-and-Fork Pork Meatball Subs with Spinach and Crunchy Seeds
description: Piled with juicy pork meatballs and dripping with rich tomato sauce, these open subs are best tackled with cutlery. If you prefer to use your hands, you can fill them instead, then roll up your sleeves and dive in.

steps.title: Roll meatballs
steps.description: Preheat the oven to 180C. Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__. Put the garlic, __pork mince__ and __half the Italian seasoning__ in a bowl and season with __salt and pepper__. Using damp hands, combine well, then shape into walnut-sized balls.

steps.title: Brown meatballs
steps.description: Put the __sunflower seeds__ in a cold medium deep frypan over medium heat. Toast, tossing, for 3-4 mins until evenly golden. Remove from the pan. Heat __2 tsp olive oil__ in the pan over medium heat. Cook the __meatballs__, turning occasionally, for 4-6 mins until browned.

steps.title: Simmer sauce
steps.description: Add __half the tomatoes*__, __remaining Italian seasoning__, __2 tbs tomato paste__, __2 tsp honey__ and __60ml (¼ cup) water__ to the meatballs. Bring to the boil, then reduce the heat to medium, cover and cook for 8 mins or until the meatballs are cooked through and the sauce is slightly reduced. Remove the pan from the heat. Taste, then season with __salt and pepper__.

steps.title: Warm baguettes
steps.description: Meanwhile, cut the __baguettes__ in half (see Make it yours). Put on an oven tray, cut side up, and bake for 8 mins or until crusty.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: While the baguettes are baking, put __1 tbs olive oil__ and __2 tsp red wine vinegar__ in a large bowl, season with __salt and pepper__ and whisk to combine. Add the __spinach__ and __sunflower seeds__ and toss to combine. Divide the __baguettes__ among plates and top with the __meatballs and sauce__. Serve with the __spinach salad__ and knives and forks, if using. Enjoy!

steps.title: Make it yours
steps.description: Want to ditch the cutlery? Cut a slit lengthwise down the middle of each baguette, taking care not to cut all the way through. Bake and then fill with the meatballs and sauce.

assumed_ingredients.name: 2 tsp red or white wine vinegar

chef.name: Bree Hutchins
chef.description: Bree loves nutritious plant-based recipes, global cuisines and cooking for celebrations.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Bree brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Criminal lawyer turned food photographer and recipe developer, Bree has eaten her way across six continents, invited herself into countless kitchens and gathered recipes from around the globe. She’s written, styled and photographed her own cookbooks, contributed to titles for leading Australian publishers and founded a start-up that sells plant-based remakes of classic treats.

name: Chimichurri Pork Steaks
subtitle: with Sweet Potato Mash and Tomato Salad
name_with_subtitle: Chimichurri Pork Steaks with Sweet Potato Mash and Tomato Salad
description: Juicy pan-seared pork steaks cooked in South American spices, a mound of sweet potato mash and a tangy tomato salad make this a standout midweek option.

steps.title: Make mash
steps.description: Peel the __sweet potatoes__ and cut into 2cm chunks. Put in a medium saucepan, cover with water and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat to medium and cook for 8-10 mins until tender. Drain, then return to the pan. Mash the sweet potato until smooth, then add __20g butter__, season with __salt and pepper__ and stir until combined.

steps.title: Make salad
steps.description: Meanwhile, coarsely chop the __tomato__. Thinly slice __half the onion*__. Pick the __parsley__ leaves and finely chop the stems.  Put __2 tsp olive oil__, __2 tsp red wine vinegar__ and __1 tsp dijon mustard__ in a large bowl, season with __salt and pepper__ and whisk to combine. Add the tomato, onion and parsley leaves and toss to coat.

steps.title: Marinate pork
steps.description: Put the __parsley stems__, __South American seasoning__ and __2 tsp olive oil__ in a large bowl, season with __salt and pepper__ and stir to combine. Add the __pork__ and turn to coat.

steps.title: Pan-fry pork
steps.description: Heat a medium frypan over medium-high heat. Cook the __pork__ for 3-4 mins each side until browned and cooked through (see Kitchen 101). Remove from the pan and rest for 4 mins.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Divide the __pork__, __sweet potato mash__ and __salad__ among plates and enjoy!

steps.title: Kitchen 101
steps.description: Pork is at its tender and juicy best when it’s cooked to medium, so don’t be afraid of a little colour. Gone are the days when we cooked pork all the way through until white (and bone dry); nowadays, it’s completely safe – and tastier – to eat pork with a hint of blush pink in the middle.

assumed_ingredients.name: 2 tsp red or white wine vinegar

name: Char Siu Fish Stir-Fry
subtitle: with Vermicelli Noodles and Roasted Peanuts
name_with_subtitle: Char Siu Fish Stir-Fry with Vermicelli Noodles and Roasted Peanuts
description: Usually used as a marinade for pork, sweet-savoury char siu sauce is fantastic with fish too. Toss with peas, spring onion and vermicelli noodles, then top with peanuts for crunch.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Bring a medium saucepan of water to the boil for the noodles and peas. Thinly slice the __spring onion__, keeping the white and green parts separate. Pat the __fish__ dry with paper towel and cut each piece in half. Crush or finely chop __1 garlic clove__. Combine the garlic, __char siu sauce__ and __2 tbs soy sauce__ in a bowl.

steps.title: Cook noodles and peas
steps.description: Cook the __noodles__ in the pan of boiling water for 5 mins. Add the __peas__ and cook for a further 2 mins or until the noodles and peas are tender. Drain, then rinse under hot water to prevent the noodles from sticking.

steps.title: Pan-fry fish
steps.description: Meanwhile, heat __1 tbs vegetable oil__ in a medium deep frypan over medium-high heat. Cook the __fish__ for 2-3 mins each side until browned and cooked through (see Kitchen 101). Remove from the pan and cut into 2-3cm chunks.

steps.title: Finish stir-fry
steps.description: Return the pan to medium heat. Stir-fry the __white part of the spring onion__ for 1 min. Add the __sauce mixture__ and __noodles and peas__ and toss for 1 min or until combined and warmed through. Add the __fish__ and gently turn to coat. Remove the pan from the heat. Taste, then season with __salt and pepper__.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Divide the __fish and noodle stir-fry__ among bowls. Scatter over the __peanuts__ and __remaining spring onion__. Enjoy!

steps.title: Kitchen 101
steps.description: Not sure if your fish is cooked through? Simply use a fork or the tip of a knife to take a peek inside the thickest part of the flesh; if it comes apart easily, the fish is cooked.

chef.name: Yasmin and Dinnerly Team
chef.description: Easy and simply delicious home-cooked meals that everyone will love.
chef.bio:
