name: Feed A Crowd: Chicken and Tomato Risotto
subtitle: Same Meal Price, More Servings!
name_with_subtitle: Feed A Crowd: Chicken and Tomato Risotto Same Meal Price, More Servings!
description: Want extra bang for your buck? Serve up more with our Feed A Crowd recipes. We've used the same amount of meat but added more hearty ingredients like filling carbs and veggies to satisfy hungry tummies. If you’re on a 2-person plan, these recipes make 4 portions; on a 4-person plan, they make 8 portions.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Finely chop the __tomatoes__. Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__. Thinly slice the __chicken__.

steps.title: Brown chicken
steps.description: Heat __1 tbs olive oil__ in a large deep frypan (see Feed A Crowd) over high heat. Cook the __chicken__, stirring, for 3-4 mins until browned. Remove from the pan.

steps.title: Start risotto
steps.description: Reduce the heat to medium-low and melt __20g butter__ in the same pan. Cook the __rice__, __tomato__, __garlic__ and __Italian seasoning__, stirring, for 2 mins or until the grains are well coated.

steps.title: Simmer risotto
steps.description: Add the __chicken__ and __1.125L (4½ cups) water__ to the pan and stir to combine. Increase the heat to medium and cook, stirring occasionally, for 22 mins or until the rice is almost tender and the liquid is absorbed. Remove the pan from the heat and stand for 5 mins. Taste, then season with __salt and pepper__.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Crumble the __feta__ into the risotto and stir to combine. Add the __spinach__ and stir until wilted. Divide the __risotto__ among bowls and enjoy!

steps.title: Feed A Crowd
steps.description: You'll need to go big here, so use the deepest frypan you've got, or a large saucepan – but note that the cooking time may vary.

chef.name: Mel Burge
chef.description: Mel loves spicy Mexican food, chicken burgers and baking for all types of occasions.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Mel brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Her passion for food and cooking began at a young age and led her to the New Idea Test Kitchen, where she developed and tested recipes over a period of 10 years. She's also worked for other major food brands including Taste, Arnott’s, Donna Hay and Perfection Fresh. Mel also specialises in cake decorating and runs a small side business in her spare time.

name: Feed A Crowd: Baked Pork Tacos
subtitle: Same Meal Price, More Servings!
name_with_subtitle: Feed A Crowd: Baked Pork Tacos Same Meal Price, More Servings!
description: Want extra bang for your buck? Serve up more with our Feed A Crowd recipes. We've used the same amount of meat but added more hearty ingredients like filling carbs and veggies to satisfy hungry tummies. If you’re on a 2-person plan, these recipes make 4 portions; on a 4-person plan, they make 8 portions.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Preheat the oven to 220C. Line 2 large oven trays with baking paper. Cut the __capsicums__ into 2cm chunks. Finely chop the __onion__ and __tomatoes__. Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__.

steps.title: Brown pork mince
steps.description: Heat __1 tbs olive oil__ in a large deep frypan over medium-high heat. Cook the __capsicum__ and __half the onion__ (see Feed A Crowd), stirring, for 5 mins or until softened. Increase the heat to high and add the __pork mince__, __Mexican spice blend__ (see Feed A Crowd) and __garlic__. Cook, breaking up the lumps with a spoon, for 3-4 mins or until the pork is browned.

steps.title: Simmer filling
steps.description: Add __half the tomato__, __2 tbs tomato sauce__ and __60ml (¼ cup) water__ to the pork mixture. Bring to the boil, then reduce the heat to medium and cook for 6-7 mins until slightly thickened. Taste, then season with __salt and pepper__. Remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Bake tacos
steps.description: Divide the __pork mixture__ among __10 tortillas*__. Fold in half, pressing together firmly. Put on the lined trays and lightly spray or brush with olive oil. Bake the __tacos__, swapping the trays halfway, for 10-12 mins until golden and crisp.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Combine the __remaining tomato__ and __remaining onion__ in a bowl and season with __salt and pepper__. Divide the __baked tacos__ among plates, scatter over the __tomato mixture__ and enjoy!

steps.title: Feed A Crowd
steps.description: We generously filled 10 tortillas, but if you want to fill them all just add all the onion and tomato when making the filling instead of reserving half of each to serve. ~ Our Mexican spice blend has a mild chilli kick, so reduce the amount if you want to avoid the heat.

chef.name: Mel Burge
chef.description: Mel loves spicy Mexican food, chicken burgers and baking for all types of occasions.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Mel brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Her passion for food and cooking began at a young age and led her to the New Idea Test Kitchen, where she developed and tested recipes over a period of 10 years. She's also worked for other major food brands including Taste, Arnott’s, Donna Hay and Perfection Fresh. Mel also specialises in cake decorating and runs a small side business in her spare time.

name: Rendang Mushroom 'Meat' Curry
subtitle: with Sweet Potato and Peas
name_with_subtitle: Rendang Mushroom 'Meat' Curry with Sweet Potato and Peas
description: Enjoy all the fantastic flavours of rendang, without the beef. Simmer umami-rich mushroom 'meat', sweet potato and peas in a fragrant coconut-based curry, then serve with steamed rice.

steps.title: Cook rice
steps.description: Rinse the __rice__ until the water runs clear. Put in a small saucepan with __250ml (1 cup) water__, cover and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Reduce the heat to low and cook for 12 mins or until tender and the water is absorbed. Turn off the heat and stand, covered, for at least 5 mins.

steps.title: Prep sweet potato
steps.description: Meanwhile, peel the __sweet potato__ and cut into 2-3cm chunks.

steps.title: Brown mushroom meat
steps.description: Heat __1 tbs vegetable oil__ in a medium deep frypan over medium-high heat. Cook the __mushroom meat__, breaking up the lumps with a spoon, for 4 mins or until browned. Add the __curry paste__ and __sweet potato__ and cook, stirring, for 1 min or until fragrant.

steps.title: Simmer curry
steps.description: Add the __coconut milk__ and __250ml (1 cup) boiling water__ to the mushroom meat mixture and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat to medium, cover and cook for 15 mins or until the sweet potato is tender. Add the __peas__, __2 tsp soy sauce__ and __½ tsp sugar__ and cook, covered, for a further 2 mins or until the peas are tender. Remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Divide the __rice__ among bowls, spoon over the __curry__ and enjoy!

steps.title: Kitchen 101
steps.description: The mushroom meat absorbs liquid on standing so it's best to serve this dish straight after cooking so the curry is still saucy.

name: Feed A Crowd: Asian Plant-Based Stir-Fry
subtitle: Same Meal Price, More Servings!
name_with_subtitle: Feed A Crowd: Asian Plant-Based Stir-Fry Same Meal Price, More Servings!
description: Want extra bang for your buck? Serve up more with our Feed A Crowd recipes. We've added more hearty ingredients like filling carbs and veggies to satisfy hungry tummies. If you’re on a 2-person plan, these recipes make 4 portions; on a 4-person plan, they make 8 portions.

steps.title: Cook rice
steps.description: Rinse the __rice__ until the water runs clear. Put in a medium saucepan with __450ml water__, cover and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Reduce the heat to low and cook for 12 mins or until tender and the water is absorbed. Turn off the heat and stand, covered, for at least 5 mins.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Meanwhile, thinly slice the __onion__. Peel the __carrots__, then halve lengthwise and thinly slice on an angle. Coarsely chop the __pak choy__, keeping the leaves and stems separate. Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__.

steps.title: Brown plant-based mince
steps.description: Heat __1 tbs vegetable oil__ in a large deep frypan over medium-high heat. Cook the plant-based mince, breaking up the lumps with a spoon, for 4-5 mins until browned. Remove from the pan. Heat __1 tbs vegetable oil__ in the same pan over medium heat. Stir-fry the __onion__, __carrot__ and __garlic__ for 3-4 mins until softened.

steps.title: Finish stir-fry
steps.description: Add the __pak choy stems__ to the onion mixture and stir-fry for 1-2 mins until tender. Add the __mince__, __char siu sauce__, __pak choy leaves__ and __2 tbs water__ and cook, stirring, until combined. Remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Divide the __rice__ and __stir-fry__ among bowls, scatter over the __sesame seeds__ and enjoy!

steps.title: Feed A Crowd
steps.description: Empty out the crisper drawer and boost your veggies by adding whatever you have on hand, from broccoli and mushrooms to capsicum and beans.

chef.name: Mel Burge
chef.description: Mel loves spicy Mexican food, chicken burgers and baking for all types of occasions.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Mel brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Her passion for food and cooking began at a young age and led her to the New Idea Test Kitchen, where she developed and tested recipes over a period of 10 years. She's also worked for other major food brands including Taste, Arnott’s, Donna Hay and Perfection Fresh. Mel also specialises in cake decorating and runs a small side business in her spare time.

name: Smoky Bean Crunch Wraps
subtitle: with Cheddar
name_with_subtitle: Smoky Bean Crunch Wraps with Cheddar
description: Presenting our version of the 'crunch wrap', the social media food trend that has everyone talking! Imagine a crispy crunchy triangle-shaped wrap, with different toppings neatly arranged between layers of pita bread. Keep an eye on our Instagram account to see how this recipe comes together!

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Preheat the oven to 200C. Line a large oven tray with baking paper. Halve the __tomato__, then thinly slice. Halve the __cucumber__ lengthwise and thinly slice on an angle. Coarsely grate the __cheese__. Drain and rinse the __beans__. Put the beans, __barbecue seasoning__ and __2 tbs barbecue sauce__ in a bowl, season with __salt and pepper__ and stir to combine.

steps.title: Lay out pitas
steps.description: Reserve __half the spinach__ for the salad. Put __2 pitas*__ on a board (see Make it yours). Make a cut from the centre of each pita to the edge closest to you.

steps.title: Assemble wraps
steps.description: Now, imagine the pita is divided into quarters. Spread __1 tbs mayonnaise__ over the bottom left quarter. Put __half the tomato__ and __half the remaining spinach__ on the top left quarter. Put __half the cheese__ on the top right quarter and __half the bean mixture__ on the bottom right quarter.

steps.title: Fold and bake wraps
steps.description: Starting with the bottom left quarter and working in a clockwise direction, fold each __pita quarter__ over the adjacent quarter until you have a triangle-shaped wrap. Repeat with the __remaining pita, mayonnaise and fillings__. Transfer the __wraps__ to the lined tray. Spray or brush with __olive oil__. Bake the wraps for 8 mins or until golden and crisp.

steps.title: Toss salad and serve up
steps.description: Meanwhile, put __3 tsp olive oil__ and __1½ tsp red wine vinegar__ in a large bowl and season with __salt and pepper__. Add the __cucumber__ and __reserved spinach__ and toss to combine. Divide the __wraps__ and __spinach salad__ among plates and enjoy!

steps.title: Make it yours
steps.description: Keep an eye out for our Instagram and Facebook videos to see how this recipe comes together! ~ Prefer a classic quesadilla instead? Simply pile the filling into the pitas, fold in half to enclose, then bake until crisp.

assumed_ingredients.name: 1½ tsp red or white wine vinegar

chef.name: Mel Burge
chef.description: Mel loves spicy Mexican food, chicken burgers and baking for all types of occasions.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Mel brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Her passion for food and cooking began at a young age and led her to the New Idea Test Kitchen, where she developed and tested recipes over a period of 10 years. She's also worked for other major food brands including Taste, Arnott’s, Donna Hay and Perfection Fresh. Mel also specialises in cake decorating and runs a small side business in her spare time.

name: Reduced-Carb Japanese Chicken Salad
subtitle: with Slivered Almonds
name_with_subtitle: Reduced-Carb Japanese Chicken Salad with Slivered Almonds
description: Toss shredded chicken and a trio of salad veg in a moreish Japanese dressing for a salad that's low in carbs but packed with freshness, flavour and crunch.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Thinly slice the __cabbage__ with a sharp knife. Halve the __cucumber__ lengthwise and thinly slice on an angle. Peel the __carrot__ and shred using a julienne peeler or coarsely grate with a box grater. Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__.

steps.title: Marinate chicken
steps.description: Put the __chicken__, __garlic__, __2 tsp soy sauce__ and __2 tsp vegetable oil__ in a bowl, season with __salt and pepper__ and toss to coat. Put the __almonds__ in a cold medium frypan over medium heat. Toast, tossing, for 3-4 mins until evenly golden. Remove from the pan.

steps.title: Cook and shred chicken
steps.description: Return the pan to medium-high heat. Cook the __chicken__ for 3-4 mins each side until browned and cooked through. Remove from the pan and cool slightly, then shred the chicken using two forks (see Make it faster).

steps.title: Toss salad
steps.description: Put the __chicken__, __cabbage__, __cucumber__, __carrot__, __almonds__ and __Japanese dressing__ in a bowl and toss to combine. Taste, then season with __salt and pepper__.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Divide the __chicken salad__ among bowls and enjoy!

steps.title: Make it faster
steps.description: To speed things up, skip shredding the chicken and serve the tenderloins whole instead.

chef.name: Mel Burge
chef.description: Mel loves spicy Mexican food, chicken burgers and baking for all types of occasions.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Mel brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Her passion for food and cooking began at a young age and led her to the New Idea Test Kitchen, where she developed and tested recipes over a period of 10 years. She's also worked for other major food brands including Taste, Arnott’s, Donna Hay and Perfection Fresh. Mel also specialises in cake decorating and runs a small side business in her spare time.

name: Reduced-Carb Masala Lamb Stir-Fry
subtitle: with Yoghurt and Tomatoes
name_with_subtitle: Reduced-Carb Masala Lamb Stir-Fry with Yoghurt and Tomatoes
description: Stir-fry lamb mince with mild Indian spices, toss through cabbage, then serve with refreshing tomato and yoghurt. It's a speedy one-pan wonder with loads of flavour but less carbs.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Thinly slice the __cabbage__ with a sharp knife or mandoline. Thinly slice the __spring onion__, keeping the white and green parts separate. Cut the __tomato__ into 1cm chunks. Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__.

steps.title: Stir-fry cabbage
steps.description: Melt __10g butter__ and __2 tsp vegetable oil__ in a medium deep frypan over medium-high heat. Stir-fry the __cabbage__ for 2-3 mins until just tender (see Kitchen 101). Season with __salt and pepper__ and remove from the pan.

steps.title: Brown lamb mince
steps.description: Heat __2 tsp vegetable oil__ in the pan over high heat. Stir-fry the __lamb mince__, breaking up the lumps with a spoon, for 3-4 mins until browned. Add the __masala seasoning__, __garlic__ and __white part of the spring onion__, then stir-fry for 1 min or until fragrant.

steps.title: Finish stir-fry
steps.description: Add the __cabbage__ to the mince mixture and stir-fry for 1-2 mins until warmed through. Taste, then season with __salt and pepper__.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Divide the __lamb stir-fry__ among bowls, scatter over the __tomato__ and __remaining spring onion__. Drizzle with the __yoghurt__ and enjoy!

steps.title: Kitchen 101
steps.description: Fast and hot is key when stir-frying! Make sure you cook over the heat indicated, stirring constantly so everything is cooked evenly. We've used a deep frypan, but you can use a wok if you have one.

chef.name: Yasmin and Dinnerly Team

Yasmin's passion for food began at a young age, watching on as her mum and dad cooked in the home kitchen and tasting global cuisines as her family travelled the world. Since then, her impressive career has spanned magazines, television and radio with a roll call of Australian brands. name: Balanced Spicy Vegetarian Gumbo
subtitle: with Barbecue Tofu and Freekeh
name_with_subtitle: Balanced Spicy Vegetarian Gumbo with Barbecue Tofu and Freekeh
description: Originating in Louisiana, gumbo is part soup, part stew. This vego version combines smoky tofu, capsicum, celery and nutty wholegrains for a hearty winter warmer.

steps.title: Cook freekeh
steps.description: Fill a medium saucepan three-quarters full with water and bring to the boil. Cook the __freekeh__, partially covered, for 18-20 mins until tender. Drain and rinse under cold water.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Meanwhile, thinly slice the __onion__. Cut the __capsicum__ and __celery__ into 3cm chunks. Quarter the __tofu__ pieces. Put __2 tsp Cajun spice blend__, __2 tbs tomato paste__, __2 tbs soy sauce__ and __430ml (1¾ cups) boiling water__ in a heatproof jug and stir to dissolve.

steps.title: Warm tofu
steps.description: Heat __1 tbs olive oil__ in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook the __tofu__ for 2 mins each side or until golden. Remove from the pan.

steps.title: Simmer gumbo
steps.description: Heat __2 tsp olive oil__ in the same pan over medium heat. Cook the __onion__, stirring, for 3 mins or until softened. Add the __capsicum__ and __celery__ and cook, stirring, for 2-3 mins until just tender. Stir in the __stock__, __tomatoes__ and __2 tsp honey__ and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat to medium and cook, stirring occasionally, for 10 mins or until the sauce is slightly thickened.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Add the __freekeh__ and __tofu__ to the gumbo and cook for a further 2 mins or until warmed through. Remove the pan from the heat. Taste, then season with __salt and pepper__. Divide the __gumbo__ among bowls and enjoy!

steps.title: Did you know?
steps.description: Gumbo is a speciality of Louisiana cooking, although its origins trace back to French, Spanish and African cultures. There are countless versions, some made with seafood or meat while others include okra, which helps to thicken the stew. And that's how the dish got its name – 'gumbo' is derived from the West African word for okra.

chef.name: Bree Hutchins
chef.description: Bree loves nutritious plant-based recipes, global cuisines and cooking for celebrations.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Bree brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. name: Low-Cal Vegan Greek Salad
subtitle: with 'Feta', White Beans and Croutons
name_with_subtitle: Low-Cal Vegan Greek Salad with 'Feta', White Beans and Croutons
description: A jumble of tomato, cucumber and vegan feta all come together in this flavour-filled Greek salad. We've thrown in white beans and baked croutons too. They're not exactly traditional, but we love how they turn salad into a belly-filling meal!

steps.title: Bake cannellini beans
steps.description: Preheat the oven to 220C. Line 2 oven trays with baking paper. Drain and rinse the __beans__. Combine __1 tsp dried oregano*__ and __1 tbs olive oil__ in a large bowl. Add the beans, season with __salt and pepper__ and toss to coat. Spread the beans over a lined tray and bake on the lower oven shelf for 15 mins or until golden.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Meanwhile, cut the __tomatoes__ into thick wedges. Quarter the __cucumber__ lengthwise, then cut into 2cm chunks. Tear or cut the __bread rolls__ into 3cm chunks.

steps.title: Bake croutons
steps.description: Put the __bread__ on the remaining lined tray and spray or brush with __olive oil__. Season with __salt and pepper__. Bake on the upper shelf for 5-6 mins until golden and crisp.

steps.title: Toss salad
steps.description: Put __1 tbs olive oil__, __1 tbs red wine vinegar__ and __1 tsp dijon mustard__ in a large bowl. Season with __salt and pepper__ and whisk to combine. Add the __beans__, __tomato__, __cucumber__ and __rocket__ and toss to coat.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Add the __croutons__ to the salad and toss to combine. Taste, then season with __salt and pepper__. Divide the __salad__ among bowls and crumble over the __vegan feta__. Enjoy!

steps.title: Make it yours
steps.description: To add more Greek salad fun, toss in a handful of olives or a sliced red capsicum.

assumed_ingredients.name: 1 tbs red or white wine vinegar

chef.name: Bree Hutchins
chef.description: Bree loves nutritious plant-based recipes, global cuisines and cooking for celebrations.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Bree brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. She’s written, styled and photographed her own cookbooks, contributed to titles for leading Australian publishers and founded a start-up that sells plant-based remakes of classic treats.

name: June Slow Cooker Special!
subtitle: Pot-Roast Chicken Marylands with Root Veggies
name_with_subtitle: June Slow Cooker Special! Pot-Roast Chicken Marylands with Root Veggies
description: Warm up this winter with our special recipes made for your slow cooker! You can also make this recipe in your oven using an ovenproof dish with a lid. For our June Slow Cooker Special, this comforting pot-roast chicken delivers on all fronts. Beat the chill and treat your tastebuds all at once with succulent chicken and earthy root veggies.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Get out your slow cooker, or if you don't have one, preheat the oven to 220C. Cut the unpeeled __potato__ into 4cm chunks. Cut the unpeeled __carrot__ into 1.5cm-thick slices. Cut the __celery__ into 7cm lengths. Peel __2 garlic cloves__, keeping them whole. Put __1 tbs country seasoning__ in a heatproof jug, add __500ml (2 cups) boiling water__ and stir to dissolve.

steps.title: Brown chicken
steps.description: Combine the __remaining country seasoning__ and __2 tbs olive oil__ in a large shallow dish. Add the __chicken__, season with __salt and pepper__ and turn to coat. Heat a medium frypan (if using a slow cooker) or a medium flameproof casserole dish over medium-high heat. Cook the chicken, turning occasionally, for 5 mins or until browned.

steps.title: Slow cooker method
steps.description: If using the slow cooker, add the __chicken and pan juices__, __potato__, __carrot__, __celery__, __garlic cloves__ and __stock__ to the slow cooker bowl (see Kitchen 101). Cover and cook on low for 8 hours.

steps.title: Casserole dish method
steps.description: If using the casserole dish, add the __potato__, __carrot__, __celery__, __garlic cloves__ and __stock__ to the chicken and bring to the boil. Transfer the dish to the oven and bake, covered, for 20 mins or until the veggies are almost tender and the chicken is cooked through. Remove the lid and bake for a further 10 mins or until the meat starts to fall away from the bones.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: For both versions, taste, then season with __salt and pepper__. Divide the __chicken__ and __veggies__ among plates or pop the dish on the table and let everyone help themselves. Enjoy!

steps.title: Kitchen 101
steps.description: Make sure the chicken and veggies are covered in the stock or they won't cook properly. If necessary, push them down in the cooker so they are submerged in the liquid.

assumed_cooking_utilities.name: 3.5L electric slow cooker or medium flameproof casserole dish with lid
medium frypan (if using the slow cooker)

chef.name: Bree Hutchins
chef.description: Bree loves nutritious plant-based recipes, global cuisines and cooking for celebrations.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Bree brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Criminal lawyer turned food photographer and recipe developer, Bree has eaten her way across six continents, invited herself into countless kitchens and gathered recipes from around the globe. She’s written, styled and photographed her own cookbooks, contributed to titles for leading Australian publishers and founded a start-up that sells plant-based remakes of classic treats.

cooking_tip: The prep and cook time listed above is for the casserole dish method. If using the slow cooker, the prep and cook time is around 8¼ hrs.

name: June Dessert Special!
subtitle: Sticky Date Puddings with Butterscotch Sauce
name_with_subtitle: June Dessert Special! Sticky Date Puddings with Butterscotch Sauce
description: Kiss the winter blues goodbye with our super-easy mini sticky date puddings. Simply make and bake the batter, then pop your puds into a bowl, bathe in a blanket of lush, warm butterscotch sauce and dig in. One taste and you'll wish it was winter all year round!

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Put the cream in the fridge for a few hours to chill (see Kitchen notes). Preheat the oven to 180C. Chop __75g butter__, then put in a bowl to soften. Put the __dates__, __baking powder__ and __180ml (¾ cup) boiling water__ in a heatproof bowl and stir to combine. Stand for 10 mins or until softened. Grease a 12-hole muffin pan.

steps.title: Make batter
steps.description: Transfer the __date mixture__ to a food processor (see Kitchen notes). Add the __softened butter__ and __110g (½ cup) brown sugar__ and process until combined. Add __150g (1 cup) flour__ and __2 eggs__ and process until just combined.

steps.title: Bake puddings
steps.description: Divide the __batter__ evenly among the muffin holes. Bake the __puddings__ for 20-25 mins until a skewer inserted into the centre comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 5 mins.

steps.title: Make butterscotch sauce
steps.description: Meanwhile, put __50g butter*__, __110g (½ cup) brown sugar__ and __125ml (½ cup) cream__ in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Cook, stirring, for 2-3 mins until the butter melts and the sugar dissolves. Bring to the boil, then remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Whisk the __remaining chilled cream__ in a bowl until soft peaks form. Divide the __warm puddings__ among bowls, drizzle over the __butterscotch sauce__ and top with the __whipped cream__. Enjoy! __Makes 12 (2 puddings per serve)__.

steps.title: Kitchen notes
steps.description: Our cream can live either in the fridge or in the pantry, but to ensure it whips easily and holds its shape, chill before use. ~ If using a stick blender, transfer the ingredients into a large, deep bowl.

chef.name: Bree Hutchins
chef.description: Bree loves nutritious plant-based recipes, global cuisines and cooking for celebrations.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Bree brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Criminal lawyer turned food photographer and recipe developer, Bree has eaten her way across six continents, invited herself into countless kitchens and gathered recipes from around the globe. She’s written, styled and photographed her own cookbooks, contributed to titles for leading Australian publishers and founded a start-up that sells plant-based remakes of classic treats.

cooking_tip: Baked goods like puddings turn out best with extra love and care, so read through the recipe first and measure out the ingredients with kitchen scales or measuring cups in each step.

name: June Dessert Special!
subtitle: Apple and Rhubarb Crumble with Orange Cream
name_with_subtitle: June Dessert Special! Apple and Rhubarb Crumble with Orange Cream
description: Nothing screams comfort food more than a classic crumble. With a base of winter fruit – think apples and ruby-red rhubarb – and an oaty, almond-studded topping, this is a 'socks on, curl up on the couch' dessert.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Put the cream in the fridge for a few hours to chill (see Kitchen notes). Chop __30g butter__ and chill until required. Preheat the oven to 180C. Peel and core the __apples__, then cut into 1.5cm-thick wedges. Cut the __rhubarb__ into 6cm lengths. Finely grate the __orange__ zest, then juice.

steps.title: Cook fruit
steps.description: Put the __apple__, __rhubarb__, __orange juice__, __half the orange zest__, __110g (½ cup) caster sugar__ and __60ml (¼ cup) water__ in a medium deep ovenproof frypan (see Kitchen notes) over high heat and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover and cook, stirring occasionally, for 3-4 mins until the fruit is softened. Remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Make crumble topping
steps.description: Meanwhile, combine the __oats__, __almonds__, __55g (¼ cup) caster sugar__, __1 tsp mixed spice*__ and __1 tbs plain flour__ in a large bowl. Add the __chilled butter__. Using your fingertips, rub the butter into the oat mixture until it resembles coarse breadcrumbs.

steps.title: Bake crumble
steps.description: Sprinkle the __crumble topping__ over the fruit mixture in the pan (don't worry if it doesn't completely cover the fruit). Bake the __crumble__ for 30-35 mins until golden and bubbling.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Meanwhile, whisk the __chilled cream__ and __1 tbs caster sugar*__ in a bowl until soft peaks form. Stir in the __remaining orange zest__. Serve the __warm crumble__ with the __whipped orange cream__ and enjoy! __Serves 3-4__.

steps.title: Kitchen notes
steps.description: Our cream can live either in the fridge or in the pantry, but to ensure it whips easily and holds its shape, chill before use. ~ Don’t have an ovenproof frypan? Use a regular medium deep frypan, then transfer to a 1L (4 cup) baking dish to bake.

assumed_cooking_utilities.name: medium deep ovenproof frypan with lid (optional)

chef.name: Bree Hutchins
chef.description: Bree loves nutritious plant-based recipes, global cuisines and cooking for celebrations.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Bree brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. She’s written, styled and photographed her own cookbooks, contributed to titles for leading Australian publishers and founded a start-up that sells plant-based remakes of classic treats.

name: June Brunch Special!
subtitle: Coconut and Caramelised Banana Porridge
name_with_subtitle: June Brunch Special! Coconut and Caramelised Banana Porridge
description: With tropical flavours of caramelised banana and coconut set against a creamy porridge backdrop, this warming bowl of goodness is the ultimate winter breakfast or brunch. Better yet, it's on the table in 20 minutes and, because it's made with coconut milk instead of regular milk, it's vegan too.

steps.title: Toast coconut
steps.description: Put __half the coconut__ in a cold medium frypan over medium heat. Toast, tossing, for 3-4 mins until evenly golden. Remove from the pan, reserving the pan.

steps.title: Start porridge
steps.description: Combine the __oats__, __half the coconut water*__, __remaining coconut__ and a __pinch of salt__ in a medium saucepan over high heat and bring to the boil.

steps.title: Simmer porridge
steps.description: Reduce the heat to medium-low and cook, stirring regularly, for 8-10 mins until thick and creamy (see Kitchen 101). Stir in __160ml (⅔ cup) coconut milk__. Remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Caramelise banana
steps.description: Meanwhile, halve the __bananas__ lengthwise. Heat __2 tsp olive oil__ in the reserved pan over medium heat. Cook the banana, turning, for 2-3 mins until caramelised. Remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Divide the __porridge__ among bowls and top with the __caramelised banana__ and __toasted coconut__. Drizzle with the __maple syrup__ and __remaining coconut milk__. Enjoy!

steps.title: Kitchen 101
steps.description: If the porridge is becoming too thick before it's fully cooked, stir in a little more coconut water.

chef.name: Bree Hutchins
chef.description: Bree loves nutritious plant-based recipes, global cuisines and cooking for celebrations.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Bree brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Criminal lawyer turned food photographer and recipe developer, Bree has eaten her way across six continents, invited herself into countless kitchens and gathered recipes from around the globe. She’s written, styled and photographed her own cookbooks, contributed to titles for leading Australian publishers and founded a start-up that sells plant-based remakes of classic treats.

name: Fan Fave: Chicken and Chips
subtitle: with Spiced Butter and Parsley Salad
name_with_subtitle: Fan Fave: Chicken and Chips with Spiced Butter and Parsley Salad
description: We all love chicken and chips and this recipe ups the flavour factor with a smoky, herby butter and a scrumptious mix of regular and sweet potato.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Preheat the oven to 220C. Line an oven tray with baking paper. Thinly slice the __onion__ with a sharp knife or mandoline. Pick the __parsley__ leaves and finely chop half the stems, discarding the remaining stems. Crush __1 small garlic clove__ (see Kitchen hack). Put __20g butter__ in a bowl to soften.

steps.title: Roast chips
steps.description: Cut the __unpeeled potato__ and __unpeeled sweet potato__ into 1.5cm-thick chips, then put on the lined tray. Drizzle with __2 tsp olive oil__, season with __salt and pepper__ and toss to coat. Roast, turning once, for 25 mins or until golden and tender.

steps.title: Pickle onion
steps.description: Meanwhile, put __1 tbs red wine vinegar__, __2 tsp olive oil__ and __½ tsp sugar__ in a bowl, season with __salt and pepper__ and stir to combine. Add the __onion__, toss to combine and set aside to pickle.

steps.title: Make spiced butter
steps.description: Add the __parsley stems__, __garlic__, __1 tsp Spanish spice blend*__ and __½ tsp dijon mustard__ to the __softened butter__, season with __salt and pepper__ and stir to combine. Put the __chicken__ flat on a board, put your hand on top and halve horizontally into 2 equal fillets. Season well with __salt and pepper__.

steps.title: Cook chicken and serve
steps.description: Heat __2 tsp olive oil__ in a medium frypan over medium-high heat. Cook the __chicken__ for 3-4 mins each side until browned and cooked through. Remove the pan from the heat. Add the __parsley leaves__ to the onion mixture and toss to combine. Divide the __chicken__, __chips__ and __parsley salad__ among plates. Top the chicken with the __spiced butter__ and enjoy!

steps.title: Kitchen hack
steps.description: Garlic used raw needs to be finely minced. If you don't have a garlic crusher, adding a little salt to the garlic on the chopping board helps.

assumed_ingredients.name: 1 tbs red or white wine vinegar

name: Pork Burgers with Special Sauce
subtitle: and Salt and Vinegar Potato Wedges
name_with_subtitle: Pork Burgers with Special Sauce and Salt and Vinegar Potato Wedges
description: The key to a great burger? A juicy patty and a sauce that makes your tastebuds sing. Teamed with salt and vinegar wedges, it's burger night perfection!

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Preheat the oven to 220C. Line an oven tray with baking paper. Cut the __unpeeled potato__ into 2cm-thick wedges. Thinly slice the __tomato__. Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__. Cut the __rolls__ in half.

steps.title: Roast wedges
steps.description: Put the __potato wedges__ on the lined tray. Drizzle with __2 tsp olive oil__ and scatter with __1 tsp country seasoning__. Season with __pepper__ and __½ tsp salt__ and roast for 25 mins or until tender.

steps.title: Shape patties
steps.description: Meanwhile, put the __pork mince__, __garlic__ and __remaining country seasoning__ in a bowl and season with __salt and pepper__. Using damp hands, combine well, then shape into 2 equal patties, slightly larger than the base of a roll.

steps.title: Cook patties
steps.description: Heat __2 tsp olive oil__ in a medium frypan over medium-high heat. Cook the __patties__ for 4-5 mins each side until browned and cooked through. Remove the pan from the heat. Meanwhile, put the __rolls__ on an oven tray and bake, cut side up, for 4-5 mins until lightly toasted.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Drizzle the __potato wedges__ with __3 tsp white vinegar__. Layer the __roll__ bases with the __tomato__, __patties__ and __burger sauce__ (see Make it yours). Sandwich with the roll tops and serve with the potato wedges. Enjoy!

steps.title: Make it yours
steps.description: If you have any lettuce or salad leaves on hand, add to your burger for some extra freshness!

chef.name: Mel Burge
chef.description: Mel loves spicy Mexican food, chicken burgers and baking for all types of occasions.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Mel brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Her passion for food and cooking began at a young age and led her to the New Idea Test Kitchen, where she developed and tested recipes over a period of 10 years. She's also worked for other major food brands including Taste, Arnott’s, Donna Hay and Perfection Fresh. Mel also specialises in cake decorating and runs a small side business in her spare time.

name: Balinese Fish Curry
subtitle: with Rice and Crispy Shallots
name_with_subtitle: Balinese Fish Curry with Rice and Crispy Shallots
description: There's nothing better than a creamy curry to warm up a winter's night. Brimming with tender fish and veggies and made with a mild Indonesian spice paste, it's perfect for the whole family.

steps.title: Cook rice
steps.description: Rinse the __rice__ until the water runs clear. Put in a small saucepan with __250ml (1 cup) water__, cover and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Reduce the heat to low and cook for 12 mins or until tender and the water is absorbed. Turn off the heat and stand, covered, for at least 5 mins.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Meanwhile, thinly slice the __zucchini__. Cut the __fish__ into 4cm chunks. Heat __1 tbs vegetable oil__ in a medium deep frypan over medium heat. Cook the __zucchini__, stirring occasionally, for 3-4 mins until tender. Season with __salt and pepper__.

steps.title: Start curry
steps.description: Add the __ayam goreng paste__ to the zucchini and cook, stirring, for 1 min or until fragrant. Add the __coconut milk__ and __180ml (¾ cup) water__ and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat to medium and cook, stirring occasionally, for 5 mins.

steps.title: Add fish to curry
steps.description: Add the __fish__ to the curry and cook, stirring occasionally, for a further 5 mins or until the fish is cooked through (see Kitchen 101) and the sauce is slightly thickened. Stir in __2 tsp soy sauce__. Taste, then season with __salt and pepper__. Remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Divide the __rice__ and __fish curry__ among bowls, scatter over the __fried shallots__ and enjoy!

steps.title: Kitchen 101
steps.description: Not sure if your fish is cooked through? Simply use a fork or the tip of a knife to take a peek inside the thickest part of the flesh; if it comes apart easily, the fish is cooked.

chef.name: Mel Burge
chef.description: Mel loves spicy Mexican food, chicken burgers and baking for all types of occasions.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Mel brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Her passion for food and cooking began at a young age and led her to the New Idea Test Kitchen, where she developed and tested recipes over a period of 10 years. She's also worked for other major food brands including Taste, Arnott’s, Donna Hay and Perfection Fresh. Mel also specialises in cake decorating and runs a small side business in her spare time.

name: Fan Fave: Chicken and Cashew Stir-Fry
subtitle: with Oyster Sauce and Steamed Rice
name_with_subtitle: Fan Fave: Chicken and Cashew Stir-Fry with Oyster Sauce and Steamed Rice
description: Whip up this takeaway fave in a flash. Stir-fry chicken breast in a lip-smacking sauce, add veggies and moreish cashews and tumble onto fragrant jasmine rice.

steps.title: Cook rice
steps.description: Rinse the __rice__ until the water runs clear. Put in a small saucepan with __250ml (1 cup) water__, cover and bring to a simmer over medium heat. Reduce the heat to low and cook for 12 mins or until tender and the water is absorbed. Turn off the heat and stand, covered, for at least 5 mins.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Meanwhile, thinly slice the __cabbage__ with a sharp knife. Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__. Peel the __carrot__, then shred using a julienne peeler or coarsely grate with a box grater. Thinly slice the __chicken__. Combine the __oyster sauce__, __2 tbs soy sauce__ and __1 tsp honey__ in a bowl.

steps.title: Stir-fry chicken
steps.description: Heat __2 tsp vegetable oil__ in a medium deep frypan over high heat. Stir-fry the __chicken__ for 2-3 mins until browned and just cooked through. Remove from the pan.

steps.title: Stir-fry veggies
steps.description: Heat __2 tsp vegetable oil__ in the same pan over medium-high heat. Add the __cabbage__, __carrot__ and __garlic__ and stir-fry for 2 mins or until tender but still with crunch.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Add the __cashews__, __sauce mixture__, __chicken__ and any resting juices to the veggies and stir-fry for 2 mins or until combined and warmed through. Taste, then season with __salt and pepper__. Remove the pan from the heat. Divide the __rice__ among plates (see Make it yours) and top with the __chicken stir-fry__. Enjoy!

steps.title: Make it yours
steps.description: Want to serve your rice the way we've done in the photo? Just scoop it into a small bowl to compact the rice, then turn it out onto a plate or bowl.

chef.name: Bree Hutchins
chef.description: Bree loves nutritious plant-based recipes, global cuisines and cooking for celebrations.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Bree brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Criminal lawyer turned food photographer and recipe developer, Bree has eaten her way across six continents, invited herself into countless kitchens and gathered recipes from around the globe. She’s written, styled and photographed her own cookbooks, contributed to titles for leading Australian publishers and founded a start-up that sells plant-based remakes of classic treats.

name: Haloumi Pasta
subtitle: with Ratatouille Sauce
name_with_subtitle: Haloumi Pasta with Ratatouille Sauce
description: Want something fresh and tasty for dinner? Brimming with golden pan-fried haloumi, zucchini and capsicum, this pasta dish is just the ticket.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Bring a medium saucepan of salted water to the boil for the spaghetti. Halve the __zucchini__ lengthwise and thickly slice. Cut the __capsicum__ into 2cm chunks. Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__. Pick the __mint__ leaves, discarding the stems. Thickly slice the __haloumi__.

steps.title: Cook spaghetti
steps.description: Cook __three-quarters of the spaghetti*__ in the pan of boiling water for 12 mins or until al dente. Reserve __60ml (¼ cup) cooking water__, then drain the spaghetti.

steps.title: Start sauce
steps.description: Meanwhile, heat __1 tbs olive oil__ in a medium deep frypan over medium-high heat. Cook the __zucchini__, __capsicum__, __garlic__ and __2 tbs tomato paste__, stirring occasionally, for 5 mins or until the vegetables are just tender.

steps.title: Finish sauce
steps.description: Add the __tomatoes__, __reserved cooking water__ and __½ tsp sugar__ to the capsicum mixture. Bring to the boil, then reduce the heat to medium and cook for 8 mins or until the sauce is slightly thickened. Stir in the __spaghetti__. Taste, then season with __salt and pepper__.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Meanwhile, heat __2 tsp olive oil__ in a small frypan over medium-high heat. Cook the __haloumi__ for 1-2 mins each side until golden. Remove from the pan, then cut or tear the slices in half. Divide the __spaghetti__ among bowls, top with the __fried haloumi__, scatter with the __mint leaves__ and enjoy!

steps.title: Make it yours
steps.description: For a spicy kick, sprinkle with chilli flakes before serving.

chef.name: Yasmin and Dinnerly Team
chef.description: Easy and simply delicious home-cooked meals that everyone will love.
chef.bio:
Yasmin's passion for food began at a young age, watching on as her mum and dad cooked in the home kitchen and tasting global cuisines as her family travelled the world. Since then, her impressive career has spanned magazines, television and radio with a roll call of Australian brands. Yasmin is also the author of two best-selling books, 7000 Islands: Cherished Recipes and Stories from the Philippines, and The Desserts of New York (And How to Eat Them All), which combine her love of food and travel.

Yasmin and the talented Dinnerly team of recipe developers, including Jane Howard and Louise Pickford, hope we've made dinnertime that much easier, tastier, quicker and more fun for you and your family. Enjoy!

name: Indian Chicken Pita Pizzas
subtitle: with Pickled Onion and Minty Yoghurt Sauce
name_with_subtitle: Indian Chicken Pita Pizzas with Pickled Onion and Minty Yoghurt Sauce
description: Top pita bread with curried chicken, caramelised onion and zingy pickled onion, then drizzle with a creamy mint sauce – it's a delicious pizza mash-up the whole family will love!

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Preheat the oven to 220C. Line a large oven tray with baking paper. Thinly slice the __onion__. Reserve a few small __mint__ sprigs, then finely chop the remaining leaves, discarding the stems. Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__. Thinly slice the __chicken__.

steps.title: Pickle onion
steps.description: Combine __1 tbs red wine vinegar__ and __½ tsp sugar__ in a bowl (see Make it yours). Add __half the onion__, season with __salt__ and toss well to combine. Set aside to pickle, tossing occasionally, until needed.

steps.title: Brown chicken
steps.description: Combine the __curry powder__, __garlic__, __remaining onion__ and __2 tsp vegetable oil__ in a large bowl. Add the __chicken__, season with __salt and pepper__ and toss to coat. Heat a medium frypan over high heat. Add the __chicken mixture__ and cook, stirring, for 4-5 mins until the chicken is browned and the onion is starting to caramelise. Remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Bake pizzas
steps.description: Combine __2 tbs tomato paste__ and __1 tbs vegetable oil__ in a bowl. Put __2 pita breads*__ on the lined tray. Spread with the __tomato mixture__, then top with the __chicken mixture__. Bake the pizzas for 8-10 mins until the bases are golden and crisp. Meanwhile, put the __yoghurt__, __chopped mint__ and __2 tsp water__ in a bowl, season with __salt and pepper__ and stir to combine.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Drain the __pickled onion__, discarding the pickling liquid. Top the __pizzas__ with the pickled onion and __reserved mint sprigs__. Drizzle with the __yoghurt sauce__, then cut into wedges and enjoy!

steps.title: Make it yours
steps.description: If you're not a fan of pickled onion, simply cook all the onion with the chicken in Step 3.

assumed_ingredients.name: 1 tbs red or white wine vinegar

chef.name: Yasmin and Dinnerly Team

name: Greek Beef Pasta Bake
subtitle: with Melted Feta
name_with_subtitle: Greek Beef Pasta Bake with Melted Feta
description: Dive into this simple take on the Greek pasta bake, pastitsio. We've replaced the traditional bechamel sauce with a melted feta topping for ultimate comfort dining.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Preheat the oven to 200C. Bring a medium saucepan of salted water to the boil for the pasta. Thinly slice the __spring onion__, keeping the white and green parts separate. Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__. Crumble the __feta__ into a bowl, add __1 tbs olive oil__ and mash with a fork until combined and slightly chunky (see Kitchen 101).

steps.title: Cook pasta
steps.description: Cook the __pasta__ in the pan of boiling water for 6 mins.  Reserve __250ml (1 cup) cooking water__, then drain the pasta.

steps.title: Brown beef
steps.description: Meanwhile, heat __2 tsp olive oil__ in a medium deep frypan over medium-high heat. Cook the __garlic__, __white part of the spring onion__ and __cumin and coriander spice blend__, stirring, for 1-2 mins until softened. Add the __beef mince__ and cook, breaking up the lumps with a spoon, for 3-4 mins until browned.

steps.title: Add pasta
steps.description: Add the __tomatoes__, __reserved cooking water__, __1 tbs tomato paste__ and __1 tbs sugar__ to the beef mixture and cook, stirring, for 1 min or until combined. Taste, then season with __salt and pepper__. Stir in the __pasta__, then remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Bake and serve up
steps.description: Transfer the __pasta mixture__ to a 1L (4 cup) baking dish. Dot the __feta mixture__ over the top and bake for 10 mins or until the feta is melted and golden and the pasta is warmed through. Divide the __pasta bake__ among bowls and scatter over the __remaining spring onion__. Enjoy!

steps.title: Kitchen 101
steps.description: Mashing the feta with olive oil makes it easier to dot over the surface of the pasta mixture before baking.

name: Beef Sausage and Rice Pilaf
subtitle: with Rich Tomato and Zucchini Sauce
name_with_subtitle: Beef Sausage and Rice Pilaf with Rich Tomato and Zucchini Sauce
description: Juicy beef sausages browned in the pan and then nestled into a kale and zucchini pilaf to finish cooking – that's what we call one-pan, big-flavour, low-fuss cooking. It may take a little longer to make, but once it's prepped and on the stove, it's hands off from there!

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Rinse the __rice__ until the water runs clear. Coarsely grate the __zucchini__. Remove the tough inner stems from the __kale__, then thinly slice the leaves. Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__.

steps.title: Brown sausages
steps.description: Heat  __2 tsp olive oil__ in a medium deep frypan over high heat. Cook the __sausages__, turning regularly, for 4-6 mins until browned. Remove from the pan, reserving the oil in the pan.

steps.title: Add rice
steps.description: Heat the same pan over medium-high heat. Add the __rice__, __zucchini__, __garlic__, __Italian seasoning__ and __1 tbs tomato paste__ and cook, stirring, for 1-2 mins until fragrant.

steps.title: Simmer pilaf
steps.description: Stir in the __tomatoes__, __1 tsp sugar__ and __250ml (1 cup) water__ and bring to the boil. Arrange the __sausages__ on top, reduce the heat to medium-low and cook, covered, for 25 mins or until the sausages are cooked through and the rice is tender. Taste, then season with __salt and pepper__.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Remove the pan from the heat. Stir in the __kale__ (see Make it yours) and stand, covered, for 5 mins or until wilted. Divide the __sausage pilaf__ among plates and enjoy!

steps.title: Make it yours
steps.description: Not everyone loves kale, especially the kids. Easy fix! Simply leave half the pilaf kale-free by adding it to one side of the pan only.

name: 20-Minute Spinach and Cheese Ravioli
subtitle: with Pear, Parmesan and Rocket Salad
name_with_subtitle: 20-Minute Spinach and Cheese Ravioli with Pear, Parmesan and Rocket Salad
description: Limited time doesn't mean settling for limited flavour. Toss plump pasta parcels of spinach and cheese in a tomato sauce, then serve with a crisp rocket salad. The best bit? It's on the table in 20 minutes!

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Bring a large saucepan of salted water to the boil for the ravioli. Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__. Shave the __parmesan__ with a vegetable peeler.

steps.title: Cook ravioli
steps.description: Cook the __ravioli__ in the pan of boiling water for 3 mins or until al dente. Drain.

steps.title: Simmer sauce
steps.description: Meanwhile, heat a __drizzle of olive oil__ in a medium deep frypan over medium heat. Cook the __garlic__, stirring, for 30 secs or until fragrant. Add the __tomatoes__, __Italian seasoning__, __1½ tsp sugar__ and __2 tbs water__ and stir to combine. Bring to the boil, then reduce the heat to medium and cook, stirring, for 3-5 mins until slightly thickened.

steps.title: Toss salad
steps.description: Meanwhile, combine a __drizzle of olive oil__, __2 tsp balsamic vinegar__ and __½ tsp honey__ in a large bowl and season with __salt and pepper__. Cut the __pear__ into thin wedges. Add the pear and __rocket__ to the dressing and toss to coat. Scatter over __half the parmesan__.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Add the __ravioli__ to the sauce and gently stir to combine (see Kitchen 101). Taste, then season with __salt and pepper__. Remove the pan from the heat. Divide the ravioli among bowls and scatter over the __remaining parmesan__. Serve with the __salad__ and enjoy!

steps.title: Kitchen 101
steps.description: Handle the cooked ravioli with care to ensure they don't break up or burst open.

chef.name: Mel Burge
chef.description: Mel loves spicy Mexican food, chicken burgers and baking for all types of occasions.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Mel brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Her passion for food and cooking began at a young age and led her to the New Idea Test Kitchen, where she developed and tested recipes over a period of 10 years. She's also worked for other major food brands including Taste, Arnott’s, Donna Hay and Perfection Fresh. Mel also specialises in cake decorating and runs a small side business in her spare time.

name: Caribbean-Rubbed Pork Steaks
subtitle: with Creamed Corn and Buttered Cabbage
name_with_subtitle: Caribbean-Rubbed Pork Steaks with Creamed Corn and Buttered Cabbage
description: Combine homemade creamed corn, buttery cabbage and juicy pork steak seasoned with warming spices for crowd-pleasing comfort food.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Discard the husk and silks from the __corn__, then slice the kernels from the cob. Thinly slice the __cabbage__. Thinly slice the __onion__. Crumble __1 stock cube*__ into a heatproof jug, add __200ml boiling water__ and stir to dissolve.

steps.title: Make creamed corn
steps.description: Heat __2 tsp olive oil__ in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook __onion__, stirring, for 5 mins or until softened. Add the __corn__, season with __salt and pepper__ and cook, stirring, for 3 mins. Add __2 tsp plain flour__ and cook, stirring, for 1 min or until golden. Add the __stock__ and __2 tbs milk__ and bring to the boil. Reduce heat to medium and cook for 10 mins or until thickened.

steps.title: Pan-fry pork
steps.description: Meanwhile, combine the __Caribbean seasoning__ and __2 tsp olive oil__ in a large bowl and season with __salt and pepper__. Add the __pork__ and turn to coat. Heat a medium frypan over medium-high heat. Cook the pork for 3-4 mins each side until browned and cooked through (see Kitchen 101). Remove from the pan and rest for 4 mins.

steps.title: Cook buttered cabbage
steps.description: Allow the same pan to cool slightly, then wipe clean with paper towel. Melt __20g butter__ in the pan over medium heat. Add the __cabbage__ and season generously with __salt and pepper__. Cook, stirring, for 3 mins or until wilted. Remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Divide the __pork__, __buttered cabbage__ and __creamed corn__ among plates. Enjoy!

steps.title: Kitchen 101
steps.description: Pork is at its tender and juicy best when it’s cooked to medium, so don’t be afraid of a little colour. Gone are the days when we cooked pork all the way through until white (and bone dry); nowadays, it's completely safe – and tastier – to eat pork with a hint of blush pink in the middle.

chef.name: Bree Hutchins
chef.description: Bree loves nutritious plant-based recipes, global cuisines and cooking for celebrations.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Bree brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Criminal lawyer turned food photographer and recipe developer, Bree has eaten her way across six continents, invited herself into countless kitchens and gathered recipes from around the globe. She’s written, styled and photographed her own cookbooks, contributed to titles for leading Australian publishers and founded a start-up that sells plant-based remakes of classic treats.

name: Chipotle Lamb Tostadas
subtitle: with Tomato Salsa and Coriander
name_with_subtitle: Chipotle Lamb Tostadas with Tomato Salsa and Coriander
description: Pile smoky lamb mince onto crisp chipotle-brushed tostadas, then scatter with a fresh tomato salsa for a serious flavour explosion!

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Preheat the oven to 220C. Line a large oven tray with baking paper. Finely chop the __tomato__ and __onion__. Pick the __coriander__ leaves and finely chop the stems. Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__.

steps.title: Make tomato salsa
steps.description: Put __2 tsp olive oil__ and __1 tsp red wine vinegar__ in a bowl, season with __salt and pepper__ and whisk to combine. Add the __tomato__ and __half the onion__ and toss to combine.

steps.title: Brown lamb
steps.description: Heat __2 tsp olive oil__ in a medium frypan over high heat. Cook the __lamb mince__, __coriander stems__, __garlic__ and __remaining onion__, breaking up the lumps with a spoon, for 3 mins or until browned. Add __half the chipotle__ and __1 tbs tomato paste__, season with __salt and pepper__ and cook, stirring, for 2-3 mins until well combined. Remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Bake chipotle tortillas
steps.description: Combine the __remaining chipotle__ (see Make it yours) and __1 tbs olive oil__ in a bowl. Brush both sides of the tortillas with the __chipotle oil__ and put on the lined tray (don't worry if they overlap slightly). Bake the tortillas, turning them over halfway, for 8-10 mins until puffed and golden.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Drain the __tomato salsa__, reserving the liquid. Divide the __chipotle tostadas__ among plates and top with the __lamb mixture__, __tomato salsa__ and __coriander leaves__. Combine the __reserved salsa liquid__ with __2 tbs mayonnaise__. Drizzle over the tostadas and enjoy!

steps.title: Make it yours
steps.description: We've suggested this amount of chipotle for a chilli kick, but if you have little ones, simply brush their tortillas with olive oil only.

assumed_ingredients.name: 1 tsp red or white wine vinegar

chef.name: Bree Hutchins
chef.description: Bree loves nutritious plant-based recipes, global cuisines and cooking for celebrations.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Bree brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Criminal lawyer turned food photographer and recipe developer, Bree has eaten her way across six continents, invited herself into countless kitchens and gathered recipes from around the globe. She’s written, styled and photographed her own cookbooks, contributed to titles for leading Australian publishers and founded a start-up that sells plant-based remakes of classic treats.

name: Tuscan Chicken and Pumpkin Stew
subtitle: with Zucchini Couscous
name_with_subtitle: Tuscan Chicken and Pumpkin Stew with Zucchini Couscous
description: Stew season has arrived! Simmered in a rich tomato sauce and spooned over zucchini-flecked couscous, this chicken and pumpkin combo will warm the cockles of your heart.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Peel the __pumpkin__, then cut into 3cm chunks. Shred the __zucchini__ using a julienne peeler or coarsely grate with a box grater. Cut the __chicken__ into 4cm chunks. Put the __couscous__ in a large heatproof bowl, pour over  __200ml boiling water__ and cover with a plate. Stand for 5 mins or until the water is absorbed. Fluff with a fork.

steps.title: Brown chicken
steps.description: Meanwhile, heat __2 tsp olive oil__ in a medium deep frypan over medium-high heat. Cook the __chicken__, turning occasionally, for 3 mins or until browned. Remove from the pan.

steps.title: Saute pumpkin
steps.description: Heat __2 tsp olive oil__ in the same pan over medium heat. Cook the __pumpkin__, stirring, for 5 mins or until golden. Season with __salt and pepper__. Add __2 tsp Tuscan seasoning__ and __1 tbs tomato paste__ and cook, stirring, for 1 min or until fragrant.

steps.title: Simmer stew
steps.description: Add the __chicken__, __tomatoes__, __2 tsp honey__ and __125ml (½ cup) water__ to the pumpkin mixture. Bring to the boil, then reduce the heat to medium and cook, stirring occasionally, for 10-12 mins until the pumpkin is tender and the chicken is cooked through. Taste, then season with __salt and pepper__. Remove the pan from the heat.

steps.title: Fry couscous and serve up
steps.description: Meanwhile, melt __20g butter__ in a medium deep frypan over medium-high heat. Add the __couscous__ and __remaining Tuscan seasoning__, season generously with __salt and pepper__ and cook, stirring, for 1-2 mins until heated through. Remove the pan from the heat, then stir through the __zucchini__. Divide the __zucchini couscous__ among bowls and ladle over the __stew__. Enjoy!

steps.title: Did you know?
steps.description: Although it looks like a grain, couscous is actually a type of pasta made from semolina flour and water. North African in origin, couscous means 'well rolled', named for the traditional way of making it – the semolina was sprinkled with water and then rolled by hand into tiny balls. Although couscous is traditionally prepared by steaming it, we've also fried it to add a lovely nutty flavour.

chef.name: Bree Hutchins
chef.description: Bree loves nutritious plant-based recipes, global cuisines and cooking for celebrations.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Bree brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. name: Balanced Chicken and Veggie Tray Bake
subtitle: with Chimichurri and Mixed Salad
name_with_subtitle: Balanced Chicken and Veggie Tray Bake with Chimichurri and Mixed Salad
description: We love the simplicity of a tray bake. Think juicy chicken thigh, capsicum and sweet potato all tossed in a herby seasoning and roasted until golden. Serve with a crisp salad for a nutritious and delicious meal.

steps.title: Roast sweet potato
steps.description: Preheat the oven to 220C. Line an oven tray with baking paper. Cut the __unpeeled sweet potato__ into 3cm chunks. Put on the lined tray, drizzle with __2 tsp olive oil__ and scatter over __2 tsp South American seasoning__. Season with __salt and pepper__ and toss to coat. Roast for 10 mins.

steps.title: Prep chicken and capsicum
steps.description: Meanwhile, cut the __capsicum__ into 2cm chunks. Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__. Combine the garlic, __remaining South American seasoning__ and __2 tsp olive oil__ in a large bowl and season with __salt and pepper__. Add the __capsicum__ and __chicken__ and turn to coat.

steps.title: Roast chicken and veggies
steps.description: Add the __capsicum__ and __chicken__ to the sweet potato and roast on the upper oven shelf for a further 20 mins or until the chicken is cooked through and the veggies are tender. Meanwhile, put the __sunflower seeds__ on a separate oven tray. Bake on the lower shelf for 4 mins or until golden.

steps.title: Make salad
steps.description: Put __2 tsp olive oil__, __2 tsp white wine vinegar__ and __½ tsp wholegrain mustard__ in a large bowl, season with __salt and pepper__ and whisk to combine. Add the __salad leaves__ and __sunflower seeds__ and toss to coat.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Slice the __chicken__ and divide among plates (see Make it yours). Serve with the __roasted veggies__ and __salad__ and enjoy!

steps.title: Make it yours
steps.description: Prefer to make this into a salad? Shred the chicken and add to the salad leaves along with the veggies. Toss to combine, then serve in bowls.

assumed_ingredients.name: 2 tsp white or red wine vinegar
½ tsp wholegrain or dijon mustard

chef.name: Mel Burge
chef.description: Mel loves spicy Mexican food, chicken burgers and baking for all types of occasions.
chef.bio: As Culinary Creative, Mel brings her love for simply delicious food to Dinnerly. Her passion for food and cooking began at a young age and led her to the New Idea Test Kitchen, where she developed and tested recipes over a period of 10 years. She's also worked for other major food brands including Taste, Arnott’s, Donna Hay and Perfection Fresh. Mel also specialises in cake decorating and runs a small side business in her spare time.

name: Low-Cal Lebanese Chicken
subtitle: with Roasted Veg and Tahini Drizzle
name_with_subtitle: Low-Cal Lebanese Chicken with Roasted Veg and Tahini Drizzle
description: Transform everyday chicken and three veg. Toss in Middle Eastern spices, combine roasted, pan-fried and fresh flavours, and finish with a creamy tahini drizzle.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Preheat the oven to 220C. Line a large oven tray with baking paper. Cut the __broccoli__ into small florets. Peel the __carrot__, then halve lengthwise and cut into wedges. Crush __1 garlic clove__.

steps.title: Roast veggies
steps.description: Put the __broccoli__ and __carrot__ on the lined tray. Lightly spray or brush with __olive oil__, season with __salt and pepper__ and toss to coat. Roast for 12-15 mins until tender.

steps.title: Marinate chicken
steps.description: Meanwhile, bring a small saucepan of salted water to the boil for the peas. Put the __chicken__, __kofta seasoning__, __half the garlic__ and __2 tsp olive oil__ in a bowl. Season with __salt and pepper__ and toss to coat.

steps.title: Pan-fry chicken
steps.description: Heat a medium frypan over medium-high heat. Cook the __chicken__ for 3-4 mins each side until browned and cooked through. Remove the pan from the heat. Meanwhile, cook the __peas__ in the pan of boiling water for 2 mins or until tender. Drain.

steps.title: Make sauce and serve up
steps.description: Put the __tahini__ and __1½ tbs hot water__ in a bowl and stir until a thick paste forms. Add the __remaining garlic__, __2 tsp olive oil__, __1 tsp white vinegar__ and a __pinch of sugar__ and stir until smooth (see Make it yours). Season with __salt__. Divide the __chicken__, __roasted veggies__ and __peas__ among plates, then drizzle with the __tahini sauce__. Enjoy!

steps.title: Make it yours
steps.description: Tahini tends to separate after sitting for a while, so needs to be stirred well. The tahini sauce brings a distinctive creamy nuttiness to the dish. If you haven't tried tahini before, we suggest serving the sauce on the side, then spooning over as much or as little as you like.

assumed_ingredients.name: 1 tsp white or red wine vinegar

name: Reduced-Carb Pork Meatball Soup
subtitle: with Coriander, Carrots and Pak Choy
name_with_subtitle: Reduced-Carb Pork Meatball Soup with Coriander, Carrots and Pak Choy
description: This one-pan wonder is warming for the soul yet light on the carbs. Simmered with juicy meatballs, tender veggies and fresh herbs, it's absolutely delicious too.

steps.title: Prep ingredients
steps.description: Cut the __pak choy__ into 3cm lengths. Peel the __carrots__, the halve lengthwise and thinly slice on an angle. Finely chop the __coriander__, keeping the leaves and stems separate. Thinly slice the __spring onion__, keeping the white and green parts separate. Crush or finely chop __2 garlic cloves__.

steps.title: Make meatballs
steps.description: Put the __pork mince__, __coriander stems__ and __garlic__ in a large bowl and season with __salt and pepper__ (see Make it yours). Using damp hands, combine well, then shape into walnut-sized balls.

steps.title: Brown meatballs
steps.description: Heat __2 tbs vegetable oil__ in a medium saucepan over high heat. Cook the __meatballs__, turning occasionally, for 5 mins or until browned. Remove from the pan, reserving the oil in the pan. Return the pan to medium heat. Stir-fry the __carrot__ and __white part of the spring onion__ for 2-3 mins until fragrant.

steps.title: Simmer soup
steps.description: Return the __meatballs__ to the pan, add the __hoisin sauce__, __1 tbs soy sauce__ and __500ml (2 cups) water__ and stir to combine. Season with __salt and pepper__. Bring to the boil, then reduce the heat to medium and cook for a further 4-5 mins until the carrot is tender and the meatballs are almost cooked through.

steps.title: Serve up
steps.description: Add the __pak choy__ to the soup and cook for a further 1-2 mins until the pak choy is tender but still with crunch and the meatballs are cooked through. Divide the __soup__ among bowls. Scatter with the __coriander leaves__ and __remaining spring onion__. Enjoy!

steps.title: Make it yours
steps.description: Like a kick of heat? Add a pinch of chilli flakes to the mince mixture or scatter over to serve if it's just for you.
